('74', 183, 0, 1, 349978) 184 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 183, 1, 2, 350020) 248. TALK TO KHUDAI KHIDMATGARS 1
('74', 183, 2, 3, 350054) PANIALA, [November 1, 1938] 2
('74', 183, 3, 4, 350084) I have now had the assurance from your own lips of what I had from Khan Saheb already.
('74', 183, 3, 5, 350171) You have adopted non violence not merely as a temporary expedient but as a creed for good.
('74', 183, 3, 6, 350262) Therefore, mere renunciation of the sword, if there is sword in your heart, will not carry you far.
('74', 183, 3, 7, 350362) Your renunciation of the sword cannot be said to be genuine unless it generates in your hearts a power the opposite of that of the sword and superior to it.
('74', 183, 3, 8, 350519) Hitherto revenge or retaliation has been held amongst you as a sacred obligation.
('74', 183, 3, 9, 350601) If you have a feud with anybody, that man becomes your enemy for all time and the feud is handed down from father to son.
('74', 183, 3, 10, 350723) In non violence even if somebody regards you as his enemy you may not so regard him in return, and of course there can be no question of revenge.
('74', 183, 3, 11, 350869) Who could be more cruel or blood thirsty than the late Gen.
('74', 183, 3, 12, 350929) Yet the Jallianwala Bagh Congress Inquiry Committee, on my advice, had refused to ask for his prosecution.
('74', 183, 3, 13, 351036) I had no trace of ill will against him in my heart.
('74', 183, 3, 14, 351088) I would have also liked to meet him personally and reach his heart, but that was to remain a mere aspiration.
('74', 183, 4, 15, 351198) At the end of his talk he was presented a poser by one of the Khudai Khidmatgars who had followed his address closely: “You expect us to protect the Hindus against the raiders and yet you tell us that we may not employ our weapons even against thieves and dacoits.
('74', 183, 4, 16, 351463) How can the two go together?” Gandhiji replied: The contradiction is only apparent.
('74', 183, 4, 17, 351547) If you have really assimilated the non violent spirit, you won’t wait for the raiders to appear on the scene, but will seek them out in their own territory and prevent the raids from taking place.
('74', 183, 4, 18, 351744) If even then a raid does take place, you will face the raiders and tell them that they can take away all your belongings but they shall touch the property of your Hindu neighbours only over your dead body.
('74', 183, 4, 19, 351950) And if there are hundreds of Khudai Khidmatgars ready to protect the Hindu hamsayas with their lives, the raiders will certainly think better of butchering in cold blood
('74', 183, 5, 20, 352120) 1 Extracted from Pyarelal’s report “In the Frontier Province VI” 2 According to Gandhi—1915 1948: A Detailed Chronology, Gandhiji was at Paniala on this date.
('74', 184, 0, 1, 352279) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 185
('74', 184, 1, 2, 352328) all the innocent and inoffensive Khudai Khidmatgars who are non violently pitched against them.
('74', 184, 1, 3, 352424) You know the story of Abdul Quadir Jilani and his forty gold mohurs with which his mother had sent him to Baghdad.
('74', 184, 1, 4, 352539) On the way the caravan was waylaid by robbers who proceeded to strip Abdul Quadir’s companions of all their belon gings.
('74', 184, 1, 5, 352660) Thereupon Abdul Quadir, who so far happened to be untou ched, shouted out to the raiders and offered them the forty gold mohurs which his mother had sewn into the lining of his tunic.
('74', 184, 1, 6, 352844) The legend goes that the raiders were so struck by the simple naivete of the boy, as the saint then was, that they not only let him go untouched but returned to his companions all their belongings.
('74', 184, 1, 7, 353042) Harijan, 26 11 1938

('74', 186, 12, 22, 356120) BAPA, I got your letter.
('74', 186, 12, 23, 356145) It is desirable that the money sent to you from here should be spent in this region.
('74', 186, 12, 24, 356230) I have not been able to study the matter carefully.
('74', 186, 12, 25, 356282) You should tour this region.
('74', 186, 12, 26, 356311) If you can bear the cold, then come this very month, otherwise in March next year.
('74', 186, 12, 27, 356394) It is extre mely cold here in December, January and February.
('74', 186, 12, 28, 356456) It is said that there are eight lakhs of Harijans in this Province.
('74', 186, 12, 29, 356524) I saw your sharp rejoinder to Ambedkar.
('74', 186, 12, 30, 356564) But who can wake up a person pretending to sleep?
('74', 186, 12, 31, 356614) Who said that you were old?
('74', 186, 12, 32, 356642) When you pass away, you will pass away in full youth.
('74', 186, 12, 33, 356696) He is old whose mind is old.
('74', 186, 12, 34, 356725) Ramdas, for instance, has become an old man in the prime of youth.
('74', 186, 12, 35, 356792) He has no zest for anything at all.

('74', 187, 1, 2, 356914) 255. MESSAGE ON OPENING OF KHADI EXHIBITION, PESHAWAR 1
('74', 187, 2, 3, 356970) [Before November 3, 1938] 2
('74', 187, 3, 4, 356998) Do not be misled by names.
('74', 187, 3, 5, 357025) A piece of Japanese cloth cannot become swadeshi merely by being labelled ‘Swadeshi’.
('74', 187, 3, 6, 357111) Only an arti cle that is wholly manufactured in India by the hands of millions of villagers and out of raw materials grown in India deserves the name of swadeshi.
('74', 187, 3, 7, 357274) Khadi alone, it will be seen, fully satisfies this test; all other cloth is a travesty of swadeshi.
('74', 187, 3, 8, 357374) Just as there can be no dawn without the sun, so there can be no genuine swadeshi without khadi.
('74', 187, 3, 9, 357471) Judged by this test, Peshawar is left far behind in the race for swadeshi.
('74', 187, 3, 10, 357546) There is only one khadi bhandar here and that too is being run at a loss.
('74', 187, 3, 11, 357620) I hope that one result of this Exhibition will be to put the khadi bhandar on a firm footing, and to preclude the possibility of its having to close down.
('74', 187, 4, 12, 357775) Harijan, 10 12 1938
('74', 187, 5, 13, 357795) 256. SPEECH AT OPENING OF KHADI EXHIBITION, PESHAWAR 3
('74', 187, 6, 14, 357850) November 3, 1938
('74', 187, 7, 15, 357867) Dr. Gopichand has thanked the Ministers for the help that they are giving to khadi work.
('74', 187, 7, 16, 357956) But I find that neither all the Ministers nor all of the Congress M. L. A.s here use khadi as habitual wear.
('74', 187, 7, 17, 358065) Some wear it only in the Assembly.
('74', 187, 7, 18, 358100) Some do not do even that.
('74', 187, 7, 19, 358126) This is contrary to both the spirit and the letter of the Congress constitution.
('74', 187, 7, 20, 358207) Even the Red Shirts have yet to become khadi clad.
('74', 187, 7, 21, 358258) If they all take to khadi, the one lakh of them will in less than no time make the whole province khadi clad.
('74', 187, 7, 22, 358368) This province is rich in the resources for the manufactures of khadi but it comes last in respect of khadi work

('74', 188, 2, 8, 359273) 257. KATHIAWAR NOTES
('74', 188, 3, 9, 359294) The following notes 1 were prepared for me by Shri Rajkumari Amrit Kaur on finishing her recent tour in Kathiawar for Harijan and khadi work.
('74', 188, 3, 10, 359436) The notes are valuable not only for the workers in Kathiawar, but contain reflections which are of all India importance.
('74', 188, 3, 11, 359557) I hope that workers will profit by the experiences recorded by the Raj kumari.
('74', 188, 3, 12, 359636) There is one suggestion she has made, which can be immediately given effect to, if what she says of the Princes is true, as I think it is.
('74', 188, 3, 13, 359775) She has credited the Princes with the opinion that they have no belief in untouchability and that they will fling open all temples to Harijans, if their people desired it.
('74', 188, 3, 14, 359947) Her suggestion, therefore, is that they need not wait for any expression of opinion on the part of their people but should build and open temples which are accessible to all.
('74', 188, 3, 15, 360122) The Princes can make it a point of visiting only these temples to the exclusion of those whose gates are barred against Harijans.
('74', 188, 3, 16, 360252) And if these temples are built and situated attractively and are well managed, they will be a powerful aid to the breaking down of untouchability.
('74', 188, 3, 17, 360399) It is possible to extend the principle to all the institutions which, for fear of wounding orthodox susceptibility, they would not dare to open to Harijans.
('74', 188, 3, 18, 360556) This is the line of least resistance.
('74', 188, 3, 19, 360594) There is not much mean ing in a pious declaration of disbelief in untouchability, if the princes cannot or will not take the cautious step suggested by the Rajkumari.
('74', 188, 3, 20, 360761) PESHAWAR, November 4, 1938 Harijan, 12 11 1938
('74', 188, 4, 21, 360808) 1 Not reproduced here.
('74', 188, 4, 22, 360831) The notes dealt with the disabilities suffered by Harijans in the various States visited by the author, such as Rajkot, Vankaner, Morvi, Jamnagar, Porbandar, Dwarka, Junagadh, Bilkha, Dhani, Amreli, Lathi, Bhavnagar, Palitana and Wadhwan.
('74', 188, 4, 23, 361070) The notes also said that khadi worth Rs. 1,000 was sold during the tour.

('74', 189, 7, 11, 361626) 259. NOTES
('74', 189, 8, 12, 361637) AUNDH REFORMS
('74', 189, 9, 13, 361651) I congratulate both the Rajasaheb and the people of Aundh on the grant of responsible government.
('74', 189, 9, 14, 361749) This small State has always been progressive.
('74', 189, 9, 15, 361795) The ruler of Aundh has but anticipated the wants of his people and has even been in advance of them in social matters.
('74', 189, 9, 16, 361914) The declaration of full responsibility was the natural result of the past acts of the ruler.
('74', 189, 9, 17, 362007) I hope that the rights conferred by the proclamation will not in any way be whittled down in drawing up the constitution.
('74', 189, 9, 18, 362129) I would suggest that the privy purse should on no account exceed rupees thirty six thousand.
('74', 189, 9, 19, 362222) There should be a definition of funda mental rights, i.
('74', 189, 9, 20, 362278) e., equality of all in the eye of the law, abolition of untouchability and liberty of speech.
('74', 189, 9, 21, 362372) The last para of the proclama tion is appealing.
('74', 189, 9, 22, 362421) It truly says that“self government implies self con trol and self sacrifice”, and adds: “in the new era that is coming to Aundh, and we hope to the whole of our country, the strong will serve the weak, the wealthy will serve the poor, the learned will serve the illiterate.” It is to be hoped that the noble example of Aundh will be copied by the other States and that its people will by their conduct prove themselves in every way worthy of the responsibility that is to devolve on them.
('74', 189, 9, 23, 362910) The fact that in the heir to the gadi they have one who, from all accounts I have received, is a true servant of the people,
('74', 190, 0, 1, 363035) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 191
('74', 190, 1, 2, 363084) must be a great help at the time of the inauguration of responsible government.
('74', 190, 1, 3, 363164) The Western education received by him has not spoiled him.
('74', 190, 1, 4, 363223) He is reported to be a votary of truth and ahimsa.
('74', 190, 1, 5, 363274) He himself takes part in village uplift, does road cleaning himself in common with other volunteers and handles the spade and the basket with as much ease as they.
('74', 190, 1, 6, 363438) He wields the pen.
('74', 190, 1, 7, 363457) He takes pride in doing the scavenging work including the removal of night soil.
('74', 190, 2, 8, 363538) ARYA SAMAJ AND FILTHY LITERATURE
('74', 190, 3, 9, 363571) Shri Dharma Dev Shastri of Kanya Gurukul, Dehra Dun, and then Acharya Dev Sharma Abhaya of Gurukul Kangri have written to me to say that my reference in my article “Filth in Literature” 1 to my daughter in law, who is studying in the Kanya Gurukul and who wrote to me about the filth she found in certain text books prescribed for her examination, has been interpreted in some quarters to mean that the Arya Samaj authorities countenance such literature.
('74', 190, 3, 10, 364026) Both the friends repudiate the suggestion in emphatic terms.
('74', 190, 3, 11, 364087) Acharya Dev Sharma Abhaya tells me that the Gurukul authorities were so meti culous about the matter that even for the works of classical poets like Kalidas they insisted on expurgated editions being printed before they would allow their students to study even a celebrated classic like Shakuntala.
('74', 190, 3, 12, 364386) What has, however, happened is that, of late, they have allowed their students to prepare for Sahitya Sammelan examinations which tolerates books containing unclean literature.
('74', 190, 3, 13, 364563) I understand that the Gurukul authorities have brought the matter to the notice of the Sammelan management and asked them to withdraw the text books which contain objectionable references.
('74', 190, 3, 14, 364752) I hope that they will not rest satisfied till they have succeeded in their battle against unclean literature forming part of students’ text books.
('74', 190, 4, 15, 364899) TO CORRESPONDENTS
('74', 190, 5, 16, 364917) No matter what warnings I issued, my correspondence is daily growing.
('74', 190, 5, 17, 364987) Even at the risk of a breakdown, I cannot cope with the whole of it.
('74', 190, 5, 18, 365056) Nor can Pyarelal, even though he often burns midnight oil.
('74', 190, 5, 19, 365115) Though Mahadev Desai is decidedly on the mend and is even being permitted to write what he feels impelled to and can write without an effort, he cannot be given any correspondence to deal with.
('74', 190, 5, 20, 365309) I must not put his health in jeopardy again.
('74', 190, 5, 21, 365354) Even a well regulated life

('74', 191, 1, 2, 365464) like his has limitations which must not be disregarded.
('74', 191, 1, 3, 365520) It is therefore a question if he can ever again be burdened with correspondence which is not strictly connected with Harijan.
('74', 191, 1, 4, 365646) Let the readers, please, recog nize my difficulty.
('74', 191, 1, 5, 365697) I have a file of papers unread.

('74', 191, 1, 22, 366938) There are, too, personal letters which I would gladly deal with if I could.
('74', 191, 1, 23, 367014) I know I can give some help or comfort to these correspondents, if I can deal with their letters as I should like to.
('74', 191, 1, 24, 367132) As it is, I must plead my inability to handle such correspondence.
('74', 191, 1, 25, 367199) What energy I have left in me has to be reserved for the general causes which, I fancy, I can still serve.
('74', 191, 1, 26, 367306) Therefore, correspondents who are awaiting answers will forgive me if they never receive any reply.
('74', 191, 1, 27, 367406) These who are in the habit of writing to me will help me much if they will restrict their correspondence only to such questions as may lend themselves to discussion or advice through the columns of Harijan.
('74', 191, 1, 28, 367613) In other words Harijan should, as far as possible, be my only letter or message to those who seek to know my views on matters which interest them and which are also of importance to the public.

('74', 192, 1, 2, 367903) 260. WHY NOT GREAT POWERS?
('74', 192, 2, 3, 367930) In the criticisms on my recent writings on the plight of Czecho slovakia, 1 I have observed one thing which demands ananswer.
('74', 192, 2, 4, 368056) Some critics argue that if the non violent remedy I have sugge sted for the Czechs is only for comparatively weak because small nations like them and not for the great powers like England or France or America, it cannot be of much value, if any.
('74', 192, 2, 5, 368302) Now if the critics will reread my article, they will see that I have refrained from suggesting it to these big powers because of their bigness, in other words, because of my timidity.
('74', 192, 2, 6, 368486) But there was a more potent reason for my not addressing them.
('74', 192, 2, 7, 368549) They were not in distress and therefore in no need of any remedy.
('74', 192, 2, 8, 368615) To use a medical expression, they were not ailing as Czechoslovakia was.
('74', 192, 2, 9, 368688) Their existence was not threatened as Czechoslovakia’s was.
('74', 192, 2, 10, 368748) Any appeal from me therefore to the great powers would have amounted to an empty and unwanted sermon.
('74', 192, 2, 11, 368850) By experience I have also found that people rarely become virtuous for virtue’s sake.
('74', 192, 2, 12, 368936) They become virtuous from necessity.
('74', 192, 2, 13, 368973) Nor is there anything wrong in a man becoming good under pressure of circumstances.
('74', 192, 2, 14, 369057) It would be no doubt better if he becomes good for its own sake.
('74', 192, 2, 15, 369122) The Czechs were given a choice either to surrender peacefully to Germany’s might or to fight single handed and risk almost certain destruction.
('74', 192, 2, 16, 369266) It was at this moment that it became necessary for one like me to present an alternative which had proved its effectiveness under somewhat similar circumstances.
('74', 192, 2, 17, 369428) My appeal to the Czechs was in my opinion as appropriate as it would have been inappropriate in the case of the great powers.
('74', 192, 2, 18, 369554) My critics might have, however, well asked why I had gone out of my self prescribed orbit to speak to a Western nation when I could not show cent per cent success of non violence on the Indian soil,— more especially now, when I had begun to entertain serious doubts as to whether Congressmen were really living up to their creed or policy of non violence.
('74', 192, 2, 19, 369910) Indeed I had in mind the limitation and the present state of uncertainty about the Congress position.
('74', 192, 2, 20, 370012) But my own faith in
('74', 192, 3, 21, 370032) 1 Vide “If I were a Czech”, 15 10 1938 and “Logical Consequence”, 8 10 1938
('74', 193, 0, 1, 370108) 194 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 193, 1, 2, 370150) the non violent remedy was as bright as ever when I wrote that article.
('74', 193, 1, 3, 370222) And I felt that in the supreme hour of its trial it would be cowardly on my part not to suggest to the Czechs the non violent remedy for acceptance.
('74', 193, 1, 4, 370371) What may ultimately prove impossible of acceptance by crores of people, undisciplined and unused till but recently to corpo rate suffering, might be possible for a small, compact, disciplined nation inured to corporate suffering.
('74', 193, 1, 5, 370601) I had no right to arrogate to myself any belief that India alone and no other nation was fit for non violent action.
('74', 193, 1, 6, 370718) I must confess that I have believed and still believe that India was the fittest nation to enforce non violent action for regaining her freedom.
('74', 193, 1, 7, 370863) In spite of signs to the contrary, I have the hope that the whole mass of people, who are more than the Congress, will respond only to non violent action.
('74', 193, 1, 8, 371018) They are the readiest of all the nations of the earth for such action.
('74', 193, 1, 9, 371089) But when a case for imme diate application of the remedy presented itself before me, I could not restrain myself from suggesting it to the Czechs for their acceptance.
('74', 193, 1, 10, 371257) It is however open to the great powers to take it up any day and cover themselves with glory and earn the eternal gratitude of posterity.
('74', 193, 1, 11, 371395) If they or any of them could shed the fear of destruction, if they disarmed themselves, they will automatically help the rest to regain their sanity.
('74', 193, 1, 12, 371545) But then these great powers have to give up imperialistic ambitions and ex ploitation of the so called uncivilized or semi civilized nations of the earth and revise their mode of life.
('74', 193, 1, 13, 371730) It means a complete revolution.
('74', 193, 1, 14, 371762) Great nations can hardly be expected in the ordinary course to move spon taneously in a direction the reverse of the one they have followed, and according to their notion of value, from victory to victory.
('74', 193, 1, 15, 371968) But miracles have happened before and may happen even in this very prosaic age.
('74', 193, 1, 16, 372048) Who can dare limit God’s power of undoing wrong?
('74', 193, 1, 17, 372097) One thing is certain.
('74', 193, 1, 18, 372119) If the mad race for armaments continues, it is bound to result in a slaughter such as has never occurred in history.
('74', 193, 1, 19, 372236) If there is a victor left the very victory will be a living death for the nation that emerges victorious.
('74', 193, 1, 20, 372342) There is no escape from the impending doom save through a bold and unconditional acceptance of the non violent method with all its glorious implications.
('74', 193, 1, 21, 372496) Democracy and violence can ill go together.
('74', 193, 1, 22, 372540) The States that are today nominally democratic have either to become frankly totalit arian or, if they are to become truly democratic, they must become courageously non violent.
('74', 193, 1, 23, 372718) It is a blasphemy to say that non violence can only be practised by individuals and never by nations which are com posed of individuals.
('74', 193, 1, 24, 372855) PESHAWAR, November 5, 1938 Harijan, 12 11 1938
('74', 194, 0, 1, 372902) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 195

('74', 194, 3, 4, 373002) MIRA, Evidently you had the call perhaps at the same hour that I felt you will have it.
('74', 194, 3, 5, 373090) As far as my recollection goes, I wrote to you also that if you felt the urge I would let you go.
('74', 194, 3, 6, 373188) Of course the idea origi nated not with me, but with Rajkumari; and I wrote to her suggesting that she should write to you directly.
('74', 194, 3, 7, 373321) But in view of your letter, all this becomes past history.
('74', 194, 3, 8, 373380) We will discuss ways and means when I am there which I hope will be on the 11th.
('74', 194, 3, 9, 373461) I hope I shall find Agatha there on my arrival.
('74', 194, 3, 10, 373509) If the final decision is for you to go, what I feel is that the sooner you can go the better, if you can stand the continental winter.
('74', 194, 3, 11, 373644) I do not want you to risk your health.
('74', 194, 3, 12, 373683) It may be that if you reconcile yourself to sterile eggs you might be able to stand the cold better, but of course you shall be the sole judge.
('74', 194, 3, 13, 373827) I am already moving with reference to the financial part of it.
('74', 194, 3, 14, 373891) I have relaxed temporarily the silence rule.
('74', 194, 3, 15, 373936) Hence I have been able to dictate this while munching grapes.

('74', 195, 6, 26, 375917) PESHAWAR, November 5, 1938

('74', 196, 5, 10, 377180) 264. SPEECH AT MEETING OF BAR ASSOCIATION, PESHAWAR 1
('74', 196, 6, 11, 377234) [November 5, 1938] 2
('74', 196, 7, 12, 377255) Gandhiji, in a witty little speech, while thanking them for the honour that they had done him, observed that he was hardly entitled to that privilege, in the first place because, as they all knew, he had been disbarred by his own Inn, and, secondly, because he had long forgotten his law.
('74', 196, 7, 13, 377544) Of late he had more often been engaged in breaking laws than in expounding or interpreting them in the courts of the land.
('74', 196, 7, 14, 377667) Still another and, perhaps, his most vital reason was his peculiar views about lawyers and doctors which he had recorded in his booklet, The Indian Home Rule.
('74', 196, 7, 15, 377826) A true lawyer, he told them, was one who placed truth and service in the first place and the emoluments of the profession in the next place only.
('74', 196, 7, 16, 377972) He did not know whether they had all adopted that ideal but if they pledged themselves to render service through their legal acumen in an altruistic spirit, he would be the first to pay them his homage.

('74', 197, 7, 17, 379468) The only condition is that he cannot simultaneously be on the register of any other organization.
('74', 197, 7, 18, 379566) You are, therefore, absolutely free to enrol as Khudai Khidmatgars if you like and no special permission is needed for it.
('74', 197, 7, 19, 379689) The Khudai Khidmatgars have proved their undoubted capacity for organization.
('74', 197, 7, 20, 379767) The presence of a picked body of Khudai Khidmat gars at a public meeting makes all the difference between order and disorder.
('74', 197, 7, 21, 379893) The principle of non violence requires that they should make the people do, through their power of love, all those things that the police does through the power of the lathi and the bullet.
('74', 197, 7, 22, 380083) When the seed of love sprouts forth in our hearts our petty quarrels and mutual bickerings will become things of the past.

('74', 198, 2, 9, 381567) 267. SPEECH AT PUBLIC MEETING, HARIPUR 1
('74', 198, 3, 10, 381608) November 6, 1938
('74', 198, 4, 11, 381625) Scientists tell us that we are descended from the orang.
('74', 198, 4, 12, 381682) That may be so, but it is not man’s destiny to live and die a brute.
('74', 198, 4, 13, 381751) In proportion as he cultivates non violence and voluntary discipline, he is contradistinguished from brute nature and fulfils his destiny.
('74', 198, 4, 14, 381890) One of the obligations that non violence places upon us is to respect the rights even of the weakest, even a child’s.
('74', 198, 5, 15, 382008) We must meet abuse by forbearance.
('74', 198, 5, 16, 382043) 3 Human nature is so constituted that if we take absolutely no notice of anger or abuse, the person indulging in it will soon weary of it and stop.
('74', 198, 5, 17, 382191) We should har bour no resentment against those who tried to create the distur bance which, without their meaning it, has taught us a valuable little lesson in forbearance.
('74', 198, 5, 18, 382363) A satyagrahi always regards the ‘enemy’ as a potential friend.
('74', 198, 5, 19, 382426) During half a century of experience of non violence I have not come across a case of enmity persisting to the end in the face of absolute non violence.
('74', 198, 5, 20, 382578) Harijan, 26 11 1938

('74', 201, 8, 22, 386973) MANSEHRA, [November 8, 1938] 2
('74', 201, 9, 23, 387004) It has become the fashion these days to say that society cannot be organized or run on non violent lines.
('74', 201, 9, 24, 387110) I join issue on that point.
('74', 201, 9, 25, 387138) In a family, when a father slaps his delinquent child, the latter does not think of retaliating.
('74', 201, 9, 26, 387235) He obeys his father not because of the deterrent

('74', 202, 1, 3, 387515) That in my opinion is an epitome of the way in which society is or should be governed.
('74', 202, 1, 4, 387602) What is true of family must be true of society which is but a larger family.
('74', 202, 1, 5, 387679) It is man’s imagination that divides the world into warring groups of enemies and friends.
('74', 202, 1, 6, 387770) In the ultimate resort it is the power of love that acts even in the midst of the clash and sustains the world.
('74', 202, 1, 7, 387882) I am told that the Red Shirts here are Red Shirts only in name.

('74', 202, 1, 11, 388310) The Red Shirt movement today has drawn attention of the whole of India and even outside.
('74', 202, 1, 12, 388399) And yet what it has achieved is only a small fraction of what has to be achieved.

('74', 203, 4, 6, 390027) Gandhiji in reply told them that whilst he could support their demand that licences for keeping fire arms should be freely issued on application, it would be too much to expect the Government to distribute fire arms free amongst the entire border population.
('74', 203, 4, 7, 390286) They could raise a fund for free distribution of fire arms if they wanted, but he had his doubts whether free distribution of and training in the use of fire arms would solve the question of transborder insecurity.
('74', 203, 4, 8, 390501) If the experience during the recent raid at Bannu was any guide, such a step would prove to be an expensive pedantry.

('74', 204, 0, 1, 392128) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 205
('74', 204, 1, 2, 392177) about Solon the great law giver of Athens.
('74', 204, 1, 3, 392220) He was asked by Croesus, who was reputed to be the wealthiest man of his age, to name the happiest man on earth.
('74', 204, 1, 4, 392333) Croesus had fondly hoped that Solon would name him.
('74', 204, 1, 5, 392385) But Solon replied that he could say nothing as no one could be adjudged happy before his end.
('74', 204, 1, 6, 392479) If Solon found it difficult to pronounce on a man’s happiness during his lifetime, how much more difficult it must be to adjudge on a man’s greatness?
('74', 204, 1, 7, 392630) True greatness in the world is not found set upon a hill, for the vulgar crowd to see.
('74', 204, 1, 8, 392717) On the contrary, my seventy years’ experience has taught me that the truly great are often those of whom and of whose greatness the world knows nothing during their lifetime.
('74', 204, 1, 9, 392892) God alone is judge of true greatness, because He knows men’s hearts.
('74', 204, 1, 10, 392961) Not only the inhabitants of Abbottabad but even the sun, the moon and the stars here were eager to have a glimpse of me!
('74', 204, 1, 11, 393082) Am I to understand, my good friends, that your city has all to itself a set of sun, moon and stars which do not shine upon Wardha or Segaon?
('74', 204, 1, 12, 393223) In Kathiawar we have a class of people known as Bhats or professional bards who make it their job to sing the praises of their chieftains for money.
('74', 204, 1, 13, 393372) Well, I won’t call you Bhats.
('74', 204, 1, 14, 393402) Banter apart, I want you to realize the mistake of indulging in hyperbolic praises of your leaders.
('74', 204, 1, 15, 393502) It neither helps them nor their work.
('74', 204, 1, 16, 393540) I would like you once for all to forget this practice of presenting laudatory addresses.
('74', 204, 1, 17, 393629) At three score and ten I for one have no desire to let what little time God has still left me be frittered away in vain theatricalities.
('74', 204, 1, 18, 393766) If an address must be pre sented, I would like it to be descriptive of the defects and short comings of the recipient of the address so that he might be helped to turn the searchlight inward and weed them out.
('74', 204, 1, 19, 393976) Ever since my arrival in this province I have been trying to ex pound to the Khudai Khidmatgars the doctrine of non violence in all its uncompromising completeness, abating not a jot, holding back nothing.
('74', 204, 1, 20, 394182) I do not claim to have understood the meaning of non vio lence in its entirety.
('74', 204, 1, 21, 394262) What I have realized is only a small and an insignificant fraction of the great whole.
('74', 204, 1, 22, 394349) It is not given to imperfect man to grasp the whole meaning of non violence or to practise it in full.
('74', 204, 1, 23, 394452) That is an attribute of God alone, the Supreme Ruler who suffers no second.
('74', 204, 1, 24, 394528) But I have constantly and ceaselessly striven for over half a century to understand it and to translate it in my own life.
('74', 204, 1, 25, 394651) The Khudai Khidmatgars have no doubt set a most brilliant example in the practise of non violence, to the extent to which they have understood it.
('74', 205, 0, 1, 394798) 206 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 205, 1, 2, 394840) earned them universal admiration.
('74', 205, 1, 3, 394874) But they have now to move a step further.
('74', 205, 1, 4, 394916) Their conception of non violence has to be broadened and their practice of it, especially in its positive aspects, to be made fuller and more intense, if they are to come out successful in the final heat.
('74', 205, 1, 5, 395121) Non violence is not mere disarmament.
('74', 205, 1, 6, 395159) Nor is it the weapon of the weak and the important.
('74', 205, 1, 7, 395211) A child who has not the strength to wield the lathi does not practise not violence.
('74', 205, 1, 8, 395295) More powerful than all the armaments, non violence is a unique force that has come into the world.
('74', 205, 1, 9, 395394) He who has not learnt to feel it to be a weapon infinitely more potent than brute force has not understood its true nature.
('74', 205, 1, 10, 395518) This non violence cannot be “taught” through word of mouth.
('74', 205, 1, 11, 395578) But it can be kindled in our heart through the grace of God, in answer to earnest prayer.
('74', 205, 1, 12, 395668) It is stated that today there are one lakh of Khudai Khidmat gars who have adopted non violence as their creed.
('74', 205, 1, 13, 395780) But before them as early as 1920, Khan Saheb came to recognize in non violence a weapon, the mightiest in the world, and his choice was made.
('74', 205, 1, 14, 395922) Eighteen years of practice of non violence have only strengthened his faith in it.
('74', 205, 1, 15, 396005) He has seen how it has made his people fearless and strong.
('74', 205, 1, 16, 396065) The prospect of losing a paltry job used to unnerve them.
('74', 205, 1, 17, 396123) They feel different beings today.
('74', 205, 1, 18, 396157) At three score and ten, my faith in non vio lence today burns brighter than ever.
('74', 205, 1, 19, 396239) People say to me, “Your pro gramme of non violence has been before the country now nearly for two decades, but where is the promised independence?” My reply is that although the creed of non violence was professed by millions, it was practised by but a few and that, too, merely as a policy.
('74', 205, 1, 20, 396531) But with all that the result that has been achieved is sufficiently striking to encourage me to carry on the experiment with the Khudai Khidmat gars and God willing it will succeed.
('74', 205, 1, 21, 396713) Harijan, 10 12 1938

('74', 210, 5, 12, 402944) 286. DISCUSSION WITH COMMUNISTS 1
('74', 210, 6, 13, 402978) [Before November 11, 1938] 2
('74', 210, 7, 14, 403007) COMMUNISTS: We confess, we do not understand what it is exactly you stand for.
('74', 210, 7, 15, 403086) We oppose you, not necessarily because we always differ from you but because we do not know your mind and so regard your actions with vague fear and distrust.
('74', 210, 7, 16, 403245) Faith would become easier if we understand you.
('74', 210, 7, 17, 403293) So we have come to you.
('74', 210, 7, 18, 403317) Possibly you too might find that some of your opinions about us needed revision, if you knew us.
('74', 210, 8, 19, 403414) And by way of illustration, they cited the resolution on civil liberty 3 that had been adopted by the A. I. C. C. at Delhi and which had occasioned the much talked of walk out on the part of a group of members.
('74', 210, 8, 20, 403625) 4 They could not understand why the “High Command” should be so anxious to steamroll that resolution through the house in spite of strong protest.
('74', 210, 9, 21, 403772) G. I must confess that I did not like the walk out.
('74', 210, 9, 22, 403824) Did it mean that you wanted the Congress to condone incitement to violence?
('74', 210, 10, 23, 403900) C. No, we have again and again made it clear that we do not want any condonation of violence or incitement to violence.
('74', 210, 10, 24, 404020) What distresses us is this.
('74', 210, 10, 25, 404048) Where as there was enlargement of civil liberty on Congress taking office, since the Haripura Congress civil liberty has actually suffered curtailment under the Congress ministries.
('74', 210, 10, 26, 404230) We are driven to feel that this cry about abuse of civil liberty has been raised merely as a convenient pretext to shield the Ministers, some of whom have been behaving exactly like the old bureaucrats.
('74', 210, 11, 27, 404433) 1 Extracted from Pyarelal’s “A Sporting Offer”.

('74', 211, 1, 2, 404869) G. I am more than glad that you have come to me, because you have come to the real culprit.
('74', 211, 1, 3, 404961) I must confess that I am the sole author of that resolution.
('74', 211, 1, 4, 405022) It is based upon unimpeachable evidence in my possession.
('74', 211, 1, 5, 405080) But you should have known from my writings that they were meant to help Ministers to avoid action against those who have incited to violence and even actually committed it.
('74', 211, 1, 6, 405253) Instead of Minis ters taking action against them my purpose was to create public opinion against violent speeches, writings or acts.

('74', 211, 3, 13, 405891) G. The question is badly put.
('74', 211, 3, 14, 405921) But my answer is there.

('74', 211, 3, 17, 406145) It would be violence if my act was meant to be a punishment.
('74', 211, 3, 18, 406206) I would like to make my position clearer still.
('74', 211, 3, 19, 406254) You cannot have the cake and eat it.
('74', 211, 3, 20, 406291) Assuming that there has been violence of speech, it has to be noticed by the Congress or the Congress Ministers.

('74', 213, 4, 13, 411362) 287. KHUDAI KHIDMATGARS AND BADSHAH KHAN
('74', 213, 5, 14, 411403) Whatever the Khudai Khidmatgars may be or may ultimately turn out to be, there can be no doubt about what their leader whom they delight to call Badshah Khan is.
('74', 213, 5, 15, 411565) He is unquestionably a man of God.
('74', 213, 5, 16, 411600) He believes in His living presence and knows that his movement will prosper only if God wills it.
('74', 213, 5, 17, 411698) Having put his whole soul into his cause, he remains indifferent as to what happens.
('74', 213, 5, 18, 411783) It is enough for him to realize that there is no deliverance for the Pathan except through out and out acceptance of non violence.
('74', 213, 5, 19, 411914) He does not take pride in the fact that the Pathan is a fine fighter.
('74', 213, 5, 20, 411984) He appreciates his bravery but he thinks that he has been spoilt by overpraise.
('74', 213, 5, 21, 412064) He does not want to see his Pathan as a goonda of society.
('74', 213, 5, 22, 412123) He believes that the Pathan has been exploited and kept in ignorance.
('74', 213, 5, 23, 412193) He wants the Pathan to become braver than he is and wants him to add true knowledge to his bravery.
('74', 213, 5, 24, 412293) This he thinks can only be achieved through non vio lence.
('74', 213, 5, 25, 412352) And as Khan Saheb believes in my non violence, he wanted me to be as long as I could among the Khudai Khidmatgars.
('74', 213, 5, 26, 412467) For me I needed no temptation to go to them.
('74', 213, 5, 27, 412512) I was myself anxious to make their acquaintance.

('74', 214, 1, 2, 412663) have done so now.
('74', 214, 1, 3, 412681) Anyway I made the attempt.
('74', 214, 1, 4, 412708) But before I proceed to describe how I approached my task and what I did, I must say a word about Khan Saheb as my host.
('74', 214, 1, 5, 412829) His one care throughout the tour was to make me as comfortable as the cir cumstances permitted.
('74', 214, 1, 6, 412925) He spared no pains to make me proof against privation or discomfort.
('74', 214, 1, 7, 412994) All my wants were anticipated by him.
('74', 214, 1, 8, 413032) And there was no fuss about what he did.
('74', 214, 1, 9, 413073) It was all perfectly natural for him.
('74', 214, 1, 10, 413111) It was all from the heart.
('74', 214, 1, 11, 413138) There is no humbug about him.
('74', 214, 1, 12, 413168) He is an utter stranger to affectation.

('74', 214, 1, 14, 413273) And so when we parted at Taxila our eyes were wet.
('74', 214, 1, 15, 413324) The parting was difficult.
('74', 214, 1, 16, 413351) And we parted in the hope that we would meet again probably in March next.
('74', 214, 1, 17, 413426) The Frontier Province must remain a place of frequent pilgrimage for me.
('74', 214, 1, 18, 413499) For though the rest of India may fail to show true non violence, there seems to be good ground for hoping that the Frontier Province will pass through the fiery ordeal.
('74', 214, 1, 19, 413668) The reason is simple.
('74', 214, 1, 20, 413690) Badshah Khan commands willing obedience from his adherents said to number more than one hundred thousand.
('74', 214, 1, 21, 413796) They hang on his lips.
('74', 214, 1, 22, 413819) He has but to say the word and it is carried out.
('74', 214, 1, 23, 413869) Whether, in spite of all the veneration he commands, the Khudai Khidmatgars will pass the test in constructive non violence remains to be seen.
('74', 214, 1, 24, 414013) Though Pyarelal has been giving a faithful record of the tour in the Frontier Province I must even at the risk of repetition in places give in my own way a resume of what has been done.
('74', 214, 1, 25, 414199) At the outset both Khan Saheb and I had come to the con clusion that instead of addressing the whole of the Khudai Khid matgars at the various centres I should confine myself to the leaders.
('74', 214, 1, 26, 414390) This would save my energy and be its wisest use.
('74', 214, 1, 27, 414439) And so it proved to be.
('74', 214, 1, 28, 414463) During the five weeks, we visited all the centres, and the talks lasted for one hour or more at each centre.
('74', 214, 1, 29, 414572) I found Khan Saheb to be a very competent and faithful interpreter.
('74', 214, 1, 30, 414640) And as he believed in what I said, he put into the translation all the force he could command.
('74', 214, 1, 31, 414735) He is a born orator and speaks with dignity and effect.
('74', 214, 1, 32, 414791) At every meeting I repeated the warning that unless they felt that in non violence they had come into possession of a force infinitely superior to the one they had and in the use of which they were adepts, they should have nothing to do with non violence and resume the arms they possessed before.
('74', 214, 1, 33, 415089) It must never be said of Khudai Khid matgars that once so brave, they had become or been made cowards
('74', 215, 0, 1, 415191) 216 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 215, 1, 2, 415233) under Khan Saheb’s influence.
('74', 215, 1, 3, 415263) Their bravery consisted not in being good marksmen but in defying death and being ever ready to bare their breasts to the bullets.
('74', 215, 1, 4, 415394) This bravery they had to keep intact and be ready to show whenever occasion demanded.
('74', 215, 1, 5, 415480) And for the truly brave such occasions occurred often enough without seeking.
('74', 215, 1, 6, 415558) This non violence was not a mere passive quality.
('74', 215, 1, 7, 415608) It was the mightiest force God had endowed man with.
('74', 215, 1, 8, 415661) Indeed, possession of non violence distinguished man from the brute creation.
('74', 215, 1, 9, 415739) It was inhe rent in every human being, but in most it lay dormant.
('74', 215, 1, 10, 415806) Perhaps the word ‘non violence’ was an inadequate rendering of ahimsa which itself was an incomplete connotation of all it was used for conveying.
('74', 215, 1, 11, 415953) A better rendering would be love or goodwill.
('74', 215, 1, 12, 415999) Violence was to be met by goodwill.
('74', 215, 1, 13, 416035) And goodwill came into play only when there was ill will matched against it.
('74', 215, 1, 14, 416112) To be good to the good is an exchange at par.
('74', 215, 1, 15, 416158) A rupee against a rupee gives no index to its quality.
('74', 215, 1, 16, 416213) It does when it is matched against an anna.
('74', 215, 1, 17, 416257) Similarly a man of good will is known only when he matches himself against one of ill will.
('74', 215, 1, 18, 416349) This non violence or goodwill was to be exercised not only against Englishmen but it must have full play even among ourselves.
('74', 215, 1, 19, 416476) Non violence against Englishmen may be a virtue of necessity, and may easily be a cover for cowardice or simple weakness.
('74', 215, 1, 20, 416598) It may be, as it often is, a mere expedience.
('74', 215, 1, 21, 416644) But it could not be an expedience when we have an equal choice between violence and non violence.
('74', 215, 1, 22, 416742) Such instances occur in domestic relations, social and political relations among ourselves, not only between rival sects of the same faith but persons belonging to different faiths.
('74', 215, 1, 23, 416924) We cannot be truly tolerant towards Englishmen if we are intolerant towards our neighbours and equals.
('74', 215, 1, 24, 417027) Hence our goodwill, if we had it in any degree, would be tested almost every day.
('74', 215, 1, 25, 417109) And if we actively exercised it, we would become habituated to its use in wider fields till at last it became second nature with us.
('74', 215, 1, 26, 417242) The very name Khan Saheb had adopted for them showed that they were to serve, not to injure, humanity.
('74', 215, 1, 27, 417345) For God took and needed no personal service.
('74', 215, 1, 28, 417390) He served His creatures without demanding any service for Himself in return.
('74', 215, 1, 29, 417467) He was unique in this as in many other things.
('74', 215, 1, 30, 417514) Therefore servants of God were to be known by the service they rendered to His creatures.
('74', 215, 1, 31, 417604) Hence the non violence of Khudai Khidmatgars had to show itself in their daily actions.
('74', 215, 1, 32, 417692) It could be so exhibited only if they were
('74', 216, 0, 1, 417735) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 217
('74', 216, 1, 2, 417784) non violent in thought, word and deed.
('74', 216, 1, 3, 417823) And even as a person who relied upon the use of force in his daily dealings would have to undergo a military training, so will a servant of God have to go through a definite training.
('74', 216, 1, 4, 418007) This was provided for in the very foundation resolution of the special Congress of 1920. It was broadened from time to time.
('74', 216, 1, 5, 418132) It was never toned down to my knowledge.
('74', 216, 1, 6, 418173) The exercise of active goodwill was to be tested through communal unity, shedding of untouchability by Hindus, the home and hand manufacture and use of khadi—a sure symbol of oneness with the millions—and prohibition of intoxicating drinks and drugs.
('74', 216, 1, 7, 418424) This fourfold programme was called a process of purification and a sure method of gaining organic freedom for the country.
('74', 216, 1, 8, 418547) This programme was followed but half heartedly by Congressmen and the country, thus betraying a lack of living faith in non violence, or faith in the method devised for its daily practice, or both.
('74', 216, 1, 9, 418745) But Khudai Khidmatgars were expected and believed to have a living faith in non violence.
('74', 216, 1, 10, 418835) Therefore they would be expected to follow out the whole of the constructive self purification programme of the Con gress.
('74', 216, 1, 11, 418958) I have added to it village sanitation, hygiene and simple medical relief in the villages.

('74', 222, 8, 16, 428855) 299. THE CONGRESS AND KHADI
('74', 222, 9, 17, 428883) I have letters from Bombay, U. P., Bengal and Sind bitterly com plaining that the khadi clause of the Congress constitution is honoured more in the breach than in the performance.
('74', 222, 9, 18, 429063) I have men tioned the four provinces not to have it inferred that in the other provinces things are better.
('74', 222, 9, 19, 429171) I have simply referred to these provinces because there are complaints from them.
('74', 222, 9, 20, 429253) People in the other provinces have not perhaps thought it worth while to draw attention to the evil which is widespread.
('74', 222, 9, 21, 429374) It may well be that correspondence on the matter from other provinces has not been brought to my notice.
('74', 222, 9, 22, 429479) The correspondents’ chief complaint is that in selecting Con gress candidates for municipalities or local boards, the Congress officials do not enforce the khadi clause for such candidates.
('74', 222, 9, 23, 429669) One correspondent says that the obligation of wearing khadi is waived because the Congress officials do not find competent enough candi dates among khadi wearers.
('74', 222, 9, 24, 429832) This would be a sound reason, if the dearth of proper khadi clad men can be proved, for altering the clause, surely not for committing a deliberate breach of the Congress constitution.
('74', 222, 9, 25, 430017) A writer justifies the waiver by arguing that there is no connection between swaraj and khadi.
('74', 222, 9, 26, 430112) This again may be a good reason for a change in the constitution but not for disregarding it.
('74', 222, 10, 27, 430206) 1 Munnalal G. Shah, addressee’s husband
('74', 223, 0, 1, 430246) 224 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 223, 1, 2, 430288) Every Congressman is a potential civil resister.
('74', 223, 1, 3, 430337) The right of civil disobdience accrues only to those who perform the duty of volun tarily obeying the laws of their State, more so the laws of their own making.
('74', 223, 1, 4, 430498) Therefore, the Congressmen are taking grave risks when they commit wilful breaches of the constitution.
('74', 223, 1, 5, 430602) And is there no connection between swaraj and khadi?
('74', 223, 1, 6, 430655) Were the Congressmen who made themselves responsible for the khadi clause in the constitution so dense that they did not see the fallacy which is obvious to some critics?
('74', 223, 1, 7, 430826) I have not hesitated to say, and I make bold to repeat now, that without khadi there is no swaraj for the millions, the hungry and the naked, and for the millions of illiterate women.
('74', 223, 1, 8, 431010) Habitual use of khadi is a sign that the wearer identifies himself with the poorest in the land, that he has patriotism and self sacrifice enough in him to wear khadi even though it may not be so soft and elegant in appearance as foreign fineries nor as cheap.
('74', 223, 1, 9, 431271) But my argument has perhaps no force with many Congressmen when anarchy reigns supreme among them.
('74', 223, 1, 10, 431370) There is another batch of letters in my file which continue to give me fresh evidence of corrup tion among Congressmen so called.
('74', 223, 1, 11, 431500) One correspondent says bogus members are increasing on a wholesale scale.
('74', 223, 1, 12, 431574) The cry comes from Orissa that Congressmen do not hesitate to spread lies in order to enlist members.
('74', 223, 1, 13, 431676) A Calcutta correspondent tells me that there are original members who have not paid their own subscriptions.
('74', 223, 1, 14, 431785) When asked, they say they cannot spare four annas per year.
('74', 223, 1, 15, 431845) The corres pondent indignantly protests that these same men spend many four anna pieces per year on cinemas.
('74', 223, 1, 16, 431954) My point however is not that these men can afford to pay and do not.
('74', 223, 1, 17, 432023) My point is that if they have not paid their subscriptions they are not Congressmen and that the register containing their names requires to be purged of them.
('74', 223, 1, 18, 432183) A U. P. correspondent says bribery and corruption are spoiling the good name of the Congress.
('74', 223, 1, 19, 432277) He says that Congressmen do not hesitate to use their influence with Collectors and other officials to have all sorts of injustices perpetrated for the sake of themselves or their relatives.
('74', 223, 1, 20, 432468) And he adds that the services are ill able to resist the pressure.
('74', 223, 1, 21, 432535) And he says the growing evil may be worse than the evil that existed when the services did wrong under instructions from British officials.
('74', 223, 1, 22, 432675) This charge is most damaging if it is true.
('74', 223, 1, 23, 432719) It requires careful investigations by the U. P. Government and the provincial Congress command.
('74', 223, 1, 24, 432815) Indeed, the whole of the irregularities I have lumped together in this
('74', 224, 0, 1, 432886) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 225
('74', 224, 1, 2, 432935) note require careful and immediate handling by the Working Committee and the Provincial Congress Committees.
('74', 224, 1, 3, 433044) If the Congress is not purged of illegalities and irregularities, it will cease to be the power it is today and will fail to fulfil expectations when the real struggle faces the country.

('74', 231, 0, 1, 442866) 232 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 231, 1, 2, 442908) 311. TALK TO TRAVANCORE STATE CONGRESS DEPUTATION 1
('74', 231, 2, 3, 442960) November 15, 1938
('74', 231, 3, 4, 442978) I have received reports that there has been violence on a con siderable scale in Travancore.
('74', 231, 3, 5, 443071) On the other hand I have received wires from the State Congress dictators saying that there has been no vio lence whatever for which they can be held responsible, that whatever violence there has been was instigated by the authorities.
('74', 231, 3, 6, 443307) It has been alleged too that there has been secret endorsement of violence by the State Congress people though they are not directly responsible for it.
('74', 231, 3, 7, 443460) What I say is that if there has been mob violence, by whomsoever wrought, it shows that the State Congress has not acquired sufficient control over the masses.
('74', 231, 3, 8, 443620) In that case civil disobedience has to be suspended even as was done by me more than once.
('74', 231, 3, 9, 443711) I admit you were behind the prison bars when most of the alleged cases of violence took place.
('74', 231, 3, 10, 443806) I appreciate also the fact that you did not get a chance of educating the masses into discipline.
('74', 231, 3, 11, 443904) 1 entirely endorse your view that the fight should not be merely to wrest a few concessions from the authorities but for establishing real responsible government.
('74', 231, 3, 12, 444067) But all that, to my mind, makes out a case for doing more spade work among the masses.
('74', 231, 3, 13, 444154) You must build from below.
('74', 231, 3, 14, 444181) You tell me that you regard the removal of the Dewan would help your movement as he is the chief obstacle in your way.
('74', 231, 3, 15, 444300) If you persist in the charges, you must be prepared to prove them.
('74', 231, 3, 16, 444367) But in my opinion it will have the inevitable result of pushing the question of responsible government into the background by bringing to the fore a purely personal issue.
('74', 231, 3, 17, 444539) I call that playing the enemy’s game.
('74', 231, 3, 18, 444577) And you would give the wrong lead to the people.
('74', 231, 3, 19, 444626) I do not want you to withdraw the allegations because they are not true, if you believe in them.
('74', 231, 3, 20, 444723) I want those allegations to be withdrawn because you have a far bigger issue at stake.
('74', 231, 3, 21, 444810) The greater includes the less.
('74', 231, 3, 22, 444841) Removal of the Dewan by itself would not give you responsible government.
('74', 231, 3, 23, 444915) A clever dewan might choose to slip out and remain in the background till the storm has blown over and in the mean time use a substitute to crush the movement.
('74', 231, 3, 24, 445075) Such things have happened before and will
('74', 231, 4, 25, 445117) 1 Extracted from Pyarelal’s “Why the Withdrawal”.
('74', 231, 4, 26, 445167) The deputation had gone to see Gandhiji at Segaon.
('74', 231, 4, 27, 445218) This, Pyarelal says, is the substance of the talk.
('74', 232, 0, 1, 445269) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 233
('74', 232, 1, 2, 445318) happen again.
('74', 232, 1, 3, 445332) On the other hand responsible government includes the power to dismiss ministers according to the popular will.
('74', 232, 1, 4, 445444) You can therefore say, without abating an iota from your charges, you do not want to dissipate your energy by pursuing these charges.
('74', 232, 1, 5, 445578) There are the two alternatives before you, both of them perfectly legitimate.
('74', 232, 1, 6, 445656) You have to make your choice.
('74', 232, 1, 7, 445686) You should know best the psychology of your people.
('74', 232, 1, 8, 445738) It may be such that the fight can be best conducted through agitation to remove the Dewan.
('74', 232, 1, 9, 445829) Personally, when I weigh the pros and cons of the matter, I feel like saying you should swallow the bitter cup and concentrate on getting the reins of power into your hands.
('74', 232, 1, 10, 446003) But whatever the decision about the allegations, I would advise you not to restart civil disobedience just now.
('74', 232, 1, 11, 446115) You should put your own house in order.
('74', 232, 1, 12, 446155) If you keep unadulterated non violence at the back of your minds, you would not say, “Let us take time by the forelock, and now that there is all this energy bubbling forth, let us consolidate our gains.” You would not capture power by madly frittering away the energy generated.
('74', 232, 1, 13, 446435) That way lies danger.
('74', 232, 1, 14, 446457) You will, if you follow that, only pave the way for the political schemers who may exploit the situation for furthering their own designs.
('74', 232, 1, 15, 446596) I would therefore ask you to go slow, steadily gathering all the threads into your hands.
('74', 232, 1, 16, 446686) You should become a homogeneous and disciplined mass by undergoing training in constructive work and non violence.
('74', 232, 1, 17, 446801) You may not take another forward step without canvassing public opinion inside and outside Travancore first.
('74', 232, 1, 18, 446910) Apparently there may be no connection between constructive work and non violence; but there is an internal logic connecting the two when constructive work is taken up as a part of a non violence programme.
('74', 232, 1, 19, 447116) The National Flag, for instance, was conceived as a symbol of unity, purity and non violence.
('74', 232, 1, 20, 447210) It is the place that we have given it in our non violence programme that gives it its significance and importance; by itself it has no virtue.
('74', 232, 1, 21, 447353) In prosecuting your constructive programme, you must always keep the background of non violence before your mind.
('74', 232, 1, 22, 447467) Then I should ask students to remain apart from the civil dis obedience part of the struggle and should not carry on any propa ganda in their midst.
('74', 232, 1, 23, 447616) It is not proper to ask students of school going age to do such work.
('74', 232, 1, 24, 447686) It is a sign of weakness.
('74', 232, 1, 25, 447712) It is like asking children to undergo suffering for their parents.
('74', 232, 1, 26, 447779) But the students can and ought to take part in the struggle by
('74', 233, 0, 1, 447842) 234 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 233, 1, 2, 447884) becoming adepts in charkha and other items in the constructive programme, as the Chinese students are doing while the fight against Japan is going on.
('74', 233, 1, 3, 448035) The Chinese students are working to preserve the essentials of Chinese culture through their programme of New Edu cation.
('74', 233, 1, 4, 448157) They are helping to create a national spirit which will remain unsubdued irrespective of the fortunes of the Chinese arms on the battle field.
('74', 233, 1, 5, 448300) The satyagraha struggle in British India had two aspects, non violent non co operation with the Government and co operation among the people themselves.
('74', 233, 1, 6, 448453) Both these aspects should constantly be kept before the mind’s eye.
('74', 233, 1, 7, 448521) The constructive programme that I have set before you necessitates perfect co operation among all the sec tions.
('74', 233, 1, 8, 448634) You will therefore go among the Pulayas and the Pariahs, frater nize with them and appeal to them as fellow countrymen and equals to come out and take their due share in the sacred fight along with the Brahmins, Ezhawas, Christians and others.
('74', 233, 1, 9, 448878) You must all become one.
('74', 233, 1, 10, 448903) You dare not leave out or antagonize a single section or community without stultifying yourselves and damaging your fight.
('74', 233, 1, 11, 449026) Then there is the prohibition work.
('74', 233, 1, 12, 449062) You would not picket just now, but you would visit the drunkards in their homes and strive with them.
('74', 233, 1, 13, 449164) Even if you do not succeed in producing immediate tangible results, it will put your struggle on a moral plane and add strength and momentum to it.
('74', 233, 1, 14, 449312) Travancore people, both men and women, are so simple in their habits.
('74', 233, 1, 15, 449382) They wear white and need very little cloth to protect them against the elements.
('74', 233, 1, 16, 449463) They can easily produce all the khadi they need.
('74', 233, 1, 17, 449512) Travancore need not import a single yard of cloth or even khadi from outside.
('74', 233, 1, 18, 449590) This means that there should be a spinning wheel in every home.
('74', 233, 1, 19, 449654) And khadi should be linked with liberty.
('74', 233, 1, 20, 449695) All the time you are spinning, you would not think in terms of your own requirements but in terms of the requirements of the nation.
('74', 233, 1, 21, 449828) You will say, ‘I want to clothe the whole nation that is naked and I must do it non violently.’ Each time you draw a thread, say to yourselves, ‘We are drawing the thread of swaraj.’ Multiply this picture millionfold and you have freedom knocking at your door.
('74', 233, 1, 22, 450089) Harijan, 28 1 1939

('74', 235, 8, 16, 452222) 1. After having observed the growth of popular feeling and the regrettable sufferings of our people during the last few months for the redress of what they understood to be their grievances, and after having discussed the whole situation with the Council and Mr. Valla bhbhai Patel, we are convinced the present struggle and sufferings should end immediately.
('74', 235, 8, 17, 452582) 2. We have decided to appoint a committee of ten gentlemen who should be subjects or servants of our State, three of whom will be State officers and seven subjects of our State whose names will be declared hereafter.
('74', 235, 8, 18, 452799) The President of the committee will be a person

('74', 238, 1, 2, 455536) 319. THE JEWS
('74', 238, 2, 3, 455550) Several letters have been received by me asking me to declare my views about the Arab Jew question in Palestine and the persecution of the Jews in Germany.
('74', 238, 2, 4, 455706) It is not without hesitation that I venture to offer my views on this very difficult question.
('74', 238, 2, 5, 455801) My sympathies are all with the Jews.
('74', 238, 2, 6, 455838) I have known them intimately in South Africa.
('74', 238, 2, 7, 455884) Some of them became life long compani ons.
('74', 238, 2, 8, 455927) Through these friends I came to learn much of their age long persecution.
('74', 238, 2, 9, 456001) They have been the untouchables of Christianity.
('74', 238, 2, 10, 456050) The parallel between their treatment by Christians and the treatment of untouchables by Hindus is very close.
('74', 238, 2, 11, 456160) Religious sanction has been invoked in both cases for the justification of the inhuman treatment meted out to them.
('74', 238, 2, 12, 456276) Apart from the friendships, therefore, there is the more common universal reason for my sympathy for the Jews.
('74', 238, 2, 13, 456387) But my sympathy does not blind me to the requirements of justice.
('74', 238, 2, 14, 456453) The cry for the national home for the Jews does not make much appeal to me.
('74', 238, 2, 15, 456529) The sanction for it is sought in the Bible and the tenacity with which the Jews have hankered after return to Palestine.
('74', 238, 2, 16, 456650) Why should they not, like other peoples of the earth, make that country their home where they are born and where they earn their livelihood?
('74', 238, 2, 17, 456791) Palestine belongs to the Arabs in the same sense that England belongs to the English or France to the French.
('74', 238, 2, 18, 456901) It is wrong and in human to impose the Jews on the Arabs.
('74', 238, 2, 19, 456959) What is going on in Palestine today cannot be justified by any moral code of conduct.
('74', 238, 2, 20, 457045) The mandates have no sanction but that of the last war.
('74', 238, 2, 21, 457101) Surely it would be a crime against humanity to reduce the proud Arabs so that Palestine can be restored to the Jews partly or wholly as their national home.
('74', 238, 2, 22, 457258) The nobler course would be to insist on a just treatment of the Jews wherever they are born and bred.
('74', 238, 2, 23, 457360) The Jews born in France are French in precisely the same sense that Christians born in France are French.
('74', 238, 2, 24, 457466) If the Jews have no home but Palestine, will they relish the idea of being forced to leave the other parts of the world in which they are settled?
('74', 238, 2, 25, 457613) Or do they want a double home where they can remain at will?
('74', 238, 2, 26, 457674) This cry for the national home affords a colourable justification for the German expulsion of the Jews.
('74', 238, 2, 27, 457778) But the German persecution of the Jews seems to have no parallel in history.
('74', 238, 2, 28, 457855) The tyrants of old never went so mad as Hitler
('74', 239, 0, 1, 457902) 240 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 239, 1, 2, 457944) seems to have gone.
('74', 239, 1, 3, 457964) And he is doing it with religious zeal.
('74', 239, 1, 4, 458004) For he is propounding a new religion of exclusive and militant nationalism in the name of which any inhumanity becomes an act of humanity to be rewarded here and hereafter.
('74', 239, 1, 5, 458177) The crime of an obviously mad but intrepid youth is being visited upon his whole race with unbelievable ferocity.
('74', 239, 1, 6, 458291) If there ever could be a justifiable war in the name of and for humanity, a war against Germany, to Can the Jews resist this organized and prevent the wanton perse cution of a whole race, would be completely justified.
('74', 239, 1, 7, 458510) But I do not believe in any war.
('74', 239, 1, 8, 458543) A discussion of the pros and cons of such a war is therefore outside my horizon or province.
('74', 239, 1, 9, 458636) But if there can be no war against Germany, even for such a crime as is being committed against the Jews, surely there can be no alliance with Germany.
('74', 239, 1, 10, 458788) How can there be alliance between a nation which claims to stand for justice and democracy and one which is the declared enemy of both?
('74', 239, 1, 11, 458924) Or is England drifting towards armed dictatorship and all it means?
('74', 239, 1, 12, 458992) Germany is showing to the world how efficiently violence can be worked when it is not hampered by any hypocrisy or weakness masquerading as humanitarianism.
('74', 239, 1, 13, 459149) It is also showing how hideous, terrible and terrifying it looks in its nakedness.shameless persecution?
('74', 239, 1, 14, 459254) Is there a way to preserve their self respect, and not to feel helpless, neglected and forlorn?
('74', 239, 1, 15, 459350) I submit there is.
('74', 239, 1, 16, 459369) No person who has faith in a living God need feel helpless or forlorn.
('74', 239, 1, 17, 459440) Jehovah of the Jews is a God more personal than the God of the Christians, the Mussalmans or the Hindus, though, as a matter of fact in essence, He is common to all and one without a second and beyond description.
('74', 239, 1, 18, 459654) But as the Jews attribute personality to God and believe that He rules every action of theirs, they ought not to feel helpless.
('74', 239, 1, 19, 459782) If I were a Jew and were born in Germany and earned my livelihood there, I would claim Germany as my home even as the tallest gentile German may, and challenge him to shoot me or cast me in the dungeon; I would refuse to be expelled or to submit to discriminating treatment.
('74', 239, 1, 20, 460057) And for doing this, I should not wait for the fellow Jews to join me in civil resistance but would have confidence that in the end the rest are bound to follow my example.
('74', 239, 1, 21, 460229) If one Jew or all the Jews were to accept the prescription here offered, he or they cannot be worse off than now.
('74', 239, 1, 22, 460343) And suffering voluntarily undergone will bring them an inner strength and joy which no number of resolutions of sympathy passed in the world
('74', 240, 0, 1, 460484) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 241
('74', 240, 1, 2, 460533) outside Germany can.
('74', 240, 1, 3, 460554) Indeed, even if Britain, France and America were to declare hostilities against Germany, they can bring no inner joy, no inner strength.
('74', 240, 1, 4, 460691) The calculated violence of Hitler may even result in a general massacre of the Jews by way of his first answer to the declaration of such hostilities.
('74', 240, 1, 5, 460842) But if the Jewish mind could be prepared for voluntary suffering, even the massacre I have imagined could be turned into a day of thanksgiving and joy that Jehovah had wrought deliverance of the race even at the hands of the tyrant.
('74', 240, 1, 6, 461075) For to the godfearing, death has no terror.
('74', 240, 1, 7, 461119) It is a joyful sleep to be followed by a waking that would be all the more refreshing for the long sleep.
('74', 240, 1, 8, 461225) It is hardly necessary for me to point out that it is easier for the Jews than for the Czechs to follow my prescription.
('74', 240, 1, 9, 461346) And they have in the Indian satyagraha campaign in South Africa an exact parallel.
('74', 240, 1, 10, 461429) There the Indians occupied precisely the same place that the Jews occupy in Germany.
('74', 240, 1, 11, 461514) The persecution had also a religious tinge.
('74', 240, 1, 12, 461558) Presi dent Kruger used to say that the white Christians were the chosen of God and Indians were inferior beings created to serve the whites.
('74', 240, 1, 13, 461699) A fundamental clause in the Transvaal constitution was that there should be no equality between the whites and coloured races including Asiatics.
('74', 240, 1, 14, 461845) There too the Indians were consigned to ghettos described as locations.
('74', 240, 1, 15, 461917) The other disabilities were almost of the same type as those of the Jews in Germany.
('74', 240, 1, 16, 462002) The Indians, a mere handful, resorted to satyagraha without any backing from the world outside or the Indian Government.
('74', 240, 1, 17, 462123) Indeed the British officials tried to dissuade the satya grahis from their contemplated step.
('74', 240, 1, 18, 462217) World opinion and the Indian Government came to their aid after eight years of fighting.
('74', 240, 1, 19, 462306) And that too was by way of diplomatic pressure not of a threat of war.
('74', 240, 1, 20, 462377) But the Jews of Germany can offer satyagraha under infinitely better auspices than the Indians of South Africa.
('74', 240, 1, 21, 462489) The Jews are a compact, homogeneous community in Germany.
('74', 240, 1, 22, 462547) They are far more gifted than the Indians of South Africa.
('74', 240, 1, 23, 462606) And they have organized world opinion behind them.
('74', 240, 1, 24, 462657) I am convinced that if someone with courage and vision can arise among them to lead them in non violent action, the winter of their despair can in the twinkling of an eye be turned into the summer of hope.
('74', 240, 1, 25, 462863) And what has today become a degrading man hunt can be turned into a calm and determined stand offered by unarmed men and women possessing the strength of suffering given to them by Jehovah.
('74', 240, 1, 26, 463053) It will be then a truly religious resistance offered against the godless fury of dehumanized man.
('74', 240, 1, 27, 463151) The German Jews will score a lasting victory over the German gentiles in
('74', 241, 0, 1, 463224) 242 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 241, 1, 2, 463266) the sense that they will have converted the latter to an appreciation of human dignity.
('74', 241, 1, 3, 463354) They will have rendered service to fellow Germans and proved their title to be the real Germans as against those who are today dragging, however unknowingly, the German name into the mire.
('74', 241, 1, 4, 463543) And now a word to the Jews in Palestine.
('74', 241, 1, 5, 463584) I have no doubt that they are going about it the wrong way.
('74', 241, 1, 6, 463644) The Palestine of the Biblical conception is not a geographical tract.
('74', 241, 1, 7, 463714) It is in their hearts.
('74', 241, 1, 8, 463737) But if they must look to the Palestine of geography as their national home, it is wrong to enter it under the shadow of the British gun.
('74', 241, 1, 9, 463874) A religious act cannot be performed with the aid of the bayonet or the bomb.
('74', 241, 1, 10, 463951) They can settle in Palestine only by the goodwill of the Arabs.
('74', 241, 1, 11, 464015) They should seek to convert the Arab heart.
('74', 241, 1, 12, 464059) The same God rules the Arab heart who rules the Jewish heart.
('74', 241, 1, 13, 464121) They can offer satyagraha in front of the Arabs and offer themselves to be shot or thrown into the Dead Sea without raising a little finger against them.
('74', 241, 1, 14, 464275) They will find the world opinion in their favour in their religious aspiration.
('74', 241, 1, 15, 464355) There are hundr eds of ways of reasoning with the Arabs, if they will only discard the help of the British bayonet.
('74', 241, 1, 16, 464471) As it is, they are co sharers with the British in despoiling a people who have done no wrong to them.
('74', 241, 1, 17, 464573) I am not defending the Arab excesses.
('74', 241, 1, 18, 464611) I wish they had chosen the way of non violence in resisting what they rightly regarded as an unwarrantable encroachment upon their country.
('74', 241, 1, 19, 464751) But according to the accepted canons of right and wrong, nothing can be said against the Arab resistance in the face of overwhelming odds.
('74', 241, 1, 20, 464890) Let the Jews who claim to be the chosen race prove their title by choosing the way of non violence for vindicating their position on earth.
('74', 241, 1, 21, 465030) Every country is their home including Palestine not by aggre ssion but by loving service.
('74', 241, 1, 22, 465120) A Jewish friend has sent me a book called The Jewish Contribution to Civilization by Cecil Roth.
('74', 241, 1, 23, 465217) It gives a record of what the Jews have done to enrich the world’s literature, art, music, drama, science, medicine, agriculture, etc.
('74', 241, 1, 24, 465352) Given the will, the Jew can refuse to be treated as the outcaste of the West, to be despised or patronized.
('74', 241, 1, 25, 465460) He can command the attention and respect of the world by being man, the chosen creation of God, instead of being man who is fast sinking to the brute and forsaken by God.
('74', 241, 1, 26, 465631) They can add to their many contributions the surpassing contribution of non violent action.
('74', 241, 1, 27, 465723) SEGAON, November 20, 1938 Harijan, 26 11 1938

('74', 242, 5, 11, 466264) 321. LETTER TO KANTILAL GANDHI
('74', 242, 6, 12, 466295) November 20, 1938
('74', 242, 7, 13, 466313) KANTI, I had got your letter.
('74', 242, 7, 14, 466343) You must have got mine.
('74', 242, 7, 15, 466367) After writing to you, I discussed the matter with R. I have not been able to convince him.
('74', 242, 7, 16, 466458) He says that there must have been some mistake in what S. saw and that the same charge was levelled against you regarding your relations with P. Ultimately it was proved that there was nothing in it.
('74', 242, 7, 17, 466658) All the same, says R., he will make a full inquiry.
('74', 242, 7, 18, 466710) But he adds: “Suppose my sister has fallen, is it not S.’s duty to bring her mother to her senses?
('74', 242, 7, 19, 466809) Was it right for her to run down to you?
('74', 242, 7, 20, 466850) Have we, who have brought her up, who have given her love, and separation from whom has made her shed tears, ceased to be of any value?
('74', 242, 7, 21, 466986) If you order, I will certainly bring S. before you even to tell her this.” In these circumstances, how could I insist any further?
('74', 242, 7, 22, 467117) Now it is for S. to show courage.
('74', 242, 7, 23, 467151) She should boldly prove P.’s misconduct, and having shown that she cannot reform P. She should try to come to me.
('74', 243, 0, 1, 467265) 244 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 243, 1, 2, 467307) may have gone astray but all the others cannot be like her.
('74', 243, 1, 3, 467367) Don’t become impatient.
('74', 243, 1, 4, 467391) It is not proper that you should give up hope of P. Her love for you has not diminished.
('74', 243, 1, 5, 467480) If it has, cannot the betrothal be cancelled even after it has been made public?
('74', 243, 1, 6, 467561) But he does not even dream of such a step.
('74', 243, 1, 7, 467604) You have become a part of that family.
('74', 243, 1, 8, 467643) You should believe that there is still room for further inquiry in this matter.
('74', 243, 1, 9, 467723) However that be, I do not want you to let this affair trouble you or take your time.
