('74', 324, 5, 6, 608406) 432. LETTER TO SUBHAS CHANDRA BOSE
('74', 324, 6, 7, 608441) Strictly Confidential SEGAON, WARDHA, December 1938
('74', 324, 7, 8, 608493) MY DEAR SUBHAS, I must dictate this as I am wilfully blind.
('74', 324, 7, 9, 608553) Whilst I am dictating this Maulana Saheb, Nalini Babu 3, and Ghanshyamdasji are listening.
('74', 324, 7, 10, 608644) We had an exhaustive discussion over the Bengal Ministry.
('74', 324, 7, 11, 608702) I am more than ever convinced that we should not aim at ousting the Ministry.
('74', 324, 7, 12, 608780) We shall gain nothing by a reshuffle.
('74', 324, 7, 13, 608818) And probably we shall lose much by including Congressmen in the Ministry.
('74', 324, 7, 14, 608892) I feel, therefore, that the best way of securing comparative purity of administration and continuity of a settled programme and policy would be to aim at having all the reforms that we desire carried out by the present Ministry.
('74', 324, 7, 15, 609121) Nalini Babu should come out, as he says he would, on a real issue being raised and the decision being taken by the Ministry against the interests of the country.
('74', 324, 7, 16, 609283) His retirement from the Ministry would then be dignified and wholly justified.
('74', 324, 7, 17, 609362) I understand that so far as the amendment of the municipal law is concerned, separate electo rate for the scheduled class is given up.
('74', 324, 7, 18, 609497) There is still insistence on separate electorate for Mussalmans.
('74', 324, 7, 19, 609562) I do not know whether opposition should be taken to the breaking point.
('74', 324, 7, 20, 609634) If the Mussalman opinion is solid in favour of separation, I think it would be wisdom to satisfy them.
('74', 324, 7, 21, 609737) I would not like them to carry the point in the teeth of the Con gress opposition.
('74', 324, 7, 22, 609820) It would be then a point against the Con gress.
('74', 324, 7, 23, 609868) If my opinion is acceptable to you, the release of the Prisoners becomes a much simpler matter than it is today.
('74', 324, 7, 24, 609981) And if this opinion

('74', 325, 0, 1, 610247) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 326
('74', 325, 1, 2, 610289) commends itself to you there should be an open declaration about the new policy.

('74', 326, 1, 2, 611858) 434. NOTES
('74', 326, 2, 3, 611869) COMPLAINT AGAINST CONGRESSMEN
('74', 326, 3, 4, 611899) I have a letter from the Rangoon Khadi Bhandar and another from Karnatak complaining that Congress committees have certified khadi which was decertified by the A. I. S. A. There is no doubt what soever as to the truth of the complaint.
('74', 326, 3, 5, 612135) I have copies of the certificates issued by two Congress bodies.
('74', 326, 3, 6, 612200) Congress committees should know that these certificates are illegal.
('74', 326, 3, 7, 612269) The only authority that can issue certificates about khadi is the A.I.S.A. No Congress committee has been, or can be, given the right unless the Congress resolution cons tituting the A. I. S. A. is changed.
('74', 326, 3, 8, 612476) There is no such thing as certified khadi.
('74', 326, 3, 9, 612519) It is impossible to certify every piece and every article made of khadi; only shops and persons can be authorized to sell khadi approved by the A. I. S. A. The original definition of khadi has been broadened to ensure an adequate wage for the manufacturers of khadi.
('74', 326, 3, 10, 612786) Those who sell any other khadi, deprive khadi workers of the wage that the A. I. S. A. has, of its own accord, ensured for them.
('74', 326, 3, 11, 612915) Let it not be said of any Congressman and Congress committee that they are interfering with the vast experiment in nation building that the A. I. S. A. is con ducting and which bids fair to put life and lustre in the dying bodies of millions of sisters whom no agency ensures even two pice per day.
('74', 326, 3, 12, 613214) I hope, therefore, that the Congress committees and Con gressmen will not only not interfere with the work of the A.I.S.A., but will give their full hearted co operation to numerous organiza tions of the A. I. S. A., especially in the sale of khadi.
('74', 326, 3, 13, 613464) If there was a steadily increasing demand, it would be possible to provide remune rative work in every famine area.
('74', 326, 4, 14, 613580) HINDUSTANI ONLY
('74', 326, 5, 15, 613596) A Muslim friend who calls himself an old Congress worker says:
('74', 326, 6, 16, 613659) The Times of India, in its issue of the 12th September last, published an abstract of your article from the Harijan under the caption ‘Congressmen Beware!’ 1. The cogent explanation you have given of the position caused by the anti Hindi agitation in Madras and the use of the Criminal Law Amendment Act is remarkably convincing.
('74', 326, 6, 17, 613989) I have no doubt that the sound advice you have
('74', 326, 7, 18, 614036) 1 Vide “Islamic Culture”, 28 1 1939
('74', 327, 0, 1, 614072) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 328
('74', 327, 1, 2, 614114) offered to the agitators will go a long way in satisfying them and that they will be brought round to the right way of thinking.
('74', 327, 1, 3, 614243) But in this connection I should like to draw your attention to an anomaly which seems to have crept in inadvertently regarding the ‘Rashtrabhasha’ for India.
('74', 327, 1, 4, 614401) To the best of my knowledge the Congress resolution on the subject contains the word ‘Hindustani’ and not ‘Hindi’.
('74', 327, 1, 5, 614516) You yourself, in all your speeches and writings, have always used the word ‘Hindustani’.
('74', 327, 1, 6, 614605) It is therefore to be regretted that a majority of Congressmen have, in contravention of the Congress resolution, been using the word ‘Hindi’.
('74', 327, 2, 7, 614748) This use of the wrong word has given rise to considerable misund erstanding and contention among the members of the differentcamps of the Congress.
('74', 327, 2, 8, 614896) To my mind it should be neither ‘Hindi’ nor ‘Urdu’, and all Congressmen when referring to the Rashtrabhasha should use the word ‘Hindustani’.
('74', 327, 2, 9, 615038) I endorse the suggestion whole heartedly.
('74', 327, 2, 10, 615080) Rashtrabhasha has only one name, i.e., Hindustani.

('74', 327, 4, 13, 615177) 435. PROHIBITION
('74', 327, 5, 14, 615194) Prohibition in the Congress provinces is not going on in the spirit in which it was conceived.
('74', 327, 5, 15, 615289) It is perhaps no fault of the Ministers.
('74', 327, 5, 16, 615330) Public opinion is not insistent.
('74', 327, 5, 17, 615363) Congress opinion is equally dormant.
('74', 327, 5, 18, 615400) Congressmen do not seem to see that prohibition means new life for many millions.
('74', 327, 5, 19, 615482) It means new and substantial accession of moral and material strength.
('74', 327, 5, 20, 615553) They do not realize that honest prohibition gives a dignity and prestige to the Congress which perhaps no other single step can give.
('74', 327, 5, 21, 615687) They do not see that prosecution of prohibition means identification with the masses and a resolute determination to refuse to have anything to do with the drink revenue.
('74', 327, 5, 22, 615858) Even such a confirmed prohibitionist like Rajaji has not had the daring to set apart the drink revenue purely for the purpose of fighting the drink evil.
('74', 327, 5, 23, 616012) He has proved in this matter too cautious for me.
('74', 327, 5, 24, 616062) Congressmen have learnt to count no cost too dear for winning freedom.
('74', 327, 5, 25, 616133) Our freedom will be the freedom of slaves if we continue to be victims of the drink and drug habit.
('74', 327, 5, 26, 616233) Is any cost too much to establish complete prohibition in all the provinces?
('74', 327, 5, 27, 616310) And yet one finds Ministers drawing up prohibition progra mmes in a proper bania spirit.
('74', 327, 5, 28, 616399) They think of their deficits.
('74', 327, 5, 29, 616429) I wonder
('74', 328, 0, 1, 616438) VOL. 74: 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 329
('74', 328, 1, 2, 616486) what they will do if all the winebibbers and opiumeaters suddenly give up their drinks and drugs !
('74', 328, 1, 3, 616585) They will manage somehow, it may be answered.
('74', 328, 1, 4, 616631) Why will they not do so voluntarily?
('74', 328, 1, 5, 616668) Surely, merit lies in doing the right thing voluntarily, not compulsorily !
('74', 328, 1, 6, 616744) The Bihar Government did not come to a standstill, when the earthquake swallowed more than their annual income.
('74', 328, 1, 7, 616856) What do the Governments all over India do, when famines and floods ruin people and materially reduce the State revenue?
('74', 328, 1, 8, 616976) I maintain that the Congress Governments break the spirit, if not the letter, of their pledge, when they delay prohibition for the sake of revenue.
('74', 328, 1, 9, 617124) They can and must make an honest attempt to raise money by fresh taxation.
('74', 328, 1, 10, 617199) The drink curse is most prevalent in urban areas.
('74', 328, 1, 11, 617249) It is in these areas that they can resort to fresh taxation.
('74', 328, 1, 12, 617310) Prohibition gives direct help to the employers of labour.
('74', 328, 1, 13, 617368) They can surely afford to bear the loss of revenue caused by prohibition.
('74', 328, 1, 14, 617442) The few months of prohibition in Ahmedabad have put money into the pockets both of the employers and the labourers.
('74', 328, 1, 15, 617558) There is no reason whatsoever why the employers should not pay for this inestimable service.
('74', 328, 1, 16, 617651) Many similar sources of revenue can easily be thought of.
('74', 328, 1, 17, 617709) I have not hesitated to suggest a grant or at least a loan without interest from the Government of India where it can be proved that the raising of additional revenue is not a practical proposition.
('74', 328, 1, 18, 617908) The only valid reason for not having immediate prohibition is want of previous experience and hence the need for caution.
('74', 328, 1, 19, 618030) I viewed the Salem experiment in that light.
('74', 328, 1, 20, 618075) The Madras Government wanted to take the first step with great deliberation and did not want to take any risk of failure.
('74', 328, 1, 21, 618197) The success of the Salem experiment should be suffi cient encouragement to go on with the whole scheme.
('74', 328, 1, 22, 618301) But it is not im possible to understand the desire of each Government to go in for prohibition in stages so as to have local experience.
('74', 328, 1, 23, 618438) It was for that reason that the Working Committee fixed three years as the period to bring about complete prohibition.
('74', 328, 1, 24, 618557) The time is running fast.
('74', 328, 1, 25, 618583) And if India is to be free of the curse within the period fixed, there should be no delay for want of money or for fear of deficit in revenue.
('74', 328, 1, 26, 618726) And if the programme is prosecuted with single minded zeal, there is no doubt that the other provinces and the States will follow.
('74', 328, 1, 27, 618857) SEGAON, December 19, 1938
('74', 328, 2, 28, 618883) Harijan, 24 12 1938
('74', 329, 0, 1, 618903) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 330
('74', 329, 1, 2, 618945) 436. DISTRICT BOARDS
('74', 329, 2, 3, 618966) It has often been borne in upon me that District Boards and Municipal Councils are excrescences involving a useless tax upon the people’s purses.
('74', 329, 2, 4, 619112) This became patent to me during the non co operation days in Mehmadabad.
('74', 329, 2, 5, 619185) I had then advised the people that, if they boycotted their council or whatever it was called, they could do their own sweeping and lighting and conduct their schools without fuss and without much expense and avoid wrangling into the bargain.
('74', 329, 2, 6, 619428) The truth of my remark became clear to me a few days ago when a member of the Surat District Board came to me, showed me a circular issued by the Board, and asked me for my blessing on their scheme.
('74', 329, 2, 7, 619627) The scheme was extra official.
('74', 329, 2, 8, 619658) There are about forty mem bers of the Board.
('74', 329, 2, 9, 619703) I write from memory.
('74', 329, 2, 10, 619724) They have really no work except to meet at stated intervals and hold debates on certain items of expenditure.
('74', 329, 2, 11, 619834) As the Board has a sweeping Congress majority and as some of the members are conscientious, they do not know how to use their time for the service of the people.
('74', 329, 2, 12, 619996) The Board has an income altogether inadequate for the expenditure required to keep all its departments in good order and condition, especially the roads.
('74', 329, 2, 13, 620150) The circular, therefore, contained a pompous advertisement that the mem bers and the officials would work during the National Week in April at road repairs, etc.
('74', 329, 2, 14, 620312) On the strength of the proverb that something is better than nothing, certainly the National Week idea was commen dable.
('74', 329, 2, 15, 620433) But it was not good enough for me.
('74', 329, 2, 16, 620468) I said, “If you want my blessing, you must begin work now and not merely for one week as a holiday, but for the whole term of your office and regularly as if you were members of the paid staff—no doubt consistently with your domestic and other obligations.
('74', 329, 2, 17, 620725) In other words, you should constitute yourselves into a national service.
('74', 329, 2, 18, 620799) You will meet officially only to vote items you must, but never to hold long debates or wrangle over petty appointments and the like.
('74', 329, 2, 19, 620933) But your real and solid work would be extra official.
('74', 329, 2, 20, 620987) You would take pride in having first class roads which you will have built yourselves.
('74', 329, 2, 21, 621074) You will run your schools efficiently.
('74', 329, 2, 22, 621113) You will see that your district has its proper supply of water, and your fields are well manured and grow crops that are useful from the national standpoint.
('74', 329, 2, 23, 621271) You will teach the people proper methods of sanitation and ensure voluntary prohibition by weaning the people from the drink habit.
('74', 329, 2, 24, 621403) You will run night schools for adults.
('74', 329, 2, 25, 621442) If you are
('74', 330, 0, 1, 621453) VOL. 74: 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 331
('74', 330, 1, 2, 621501) in earnest about your duty, you will be too few for the task.
('74', 330, 1, 3, 621563) You will set an example to the other boards and you will justify the choice of the electors.
('74', 330, 1, 4, 621656) The result will be that the electors themselves and the others will become a voluntary brigade of workers who will revolutionize the life of the people around you.
('74', 330, 1, 5, 621820) If you take to heart what I am telling you, you will find at once that you cannot do without hand ginning, hand carding, hand spinning and hand weaving This will give full occupation during leisure hours to every boy, girl, man and woman who is not disabled for light labour, and you will immediately add a good few lacs of rupees to your income as a district.
('74', 330, 1, 6, 622181) When you have achieved this programme you will have my blessings.
('74', 330, 1, 7, 622247) I shall become your advertising agent.
('74', 330, 1, 8, 622286) If you cannot do this, do not play with your work by having a spectacular demon stration of your holiday patriotism.
('74', 330, 1, 9, 622403) I fear, however, that the District Boards in India will not quite approve of the programme of voluntary service I have sketched above.
('74', 330, 1, 10, 622538) I, therefore, suggest that at least the Congress provinces have a model and novel legislation constituting municipal, local and district boards on the basis of efficiency.
('74', 330, 1, 11, 622710) I would have them elected, but there would be very few men and women capable of doing administrative, plodding work.
('74', 330, 1, 12, 622827) Each one of the members will have his work cut out for him.
('74', 330, 1, 13, 622887) I should impress the services of the paid officials side by side with the elected members who will be at once their masters and co workers.
('74', 330, 1, 14, 623027) This is but the barest outline of Boards of my notion.
('74', 330, 1, 15, 623082) The Congress is a revolutionary body in the widest and the wisest sense.
('74', 330, 1, 16, 623155) It must be original.
('74', 330, 1, 17, 623176) All its activities must be derived from its creed of non violence.
('74', 330, 1, 18, 623243) There must be a perfect chain linking the smallest to the biggest unit after the same pattern, so that he who runs may see that it is an artistic whole designed to answer the main purpose.
('74', 330, 1, 19, 623432) This presupposes one united mind and will in the Congress—not the mind and will of one man but the minds and wills of many men and women acting as one mind and one will.
('74', 330, 1, 20, 623602) SEGAON, December 19, 1938
('74', 330, 2, 21, 623628) Harijan, 24 12 1938

('74', 332, 10, 17, 625588) 441. LETTER TO N. M. JOSHI
('74', 332, 11, 18, 625615) SEGAON, WARDHA, December 21, 1938
('74', 332, 12, 19, 625649) MY DEAR JOSHI, I am very grateful to you for your two letters containing an exhaustive reply to my letter.
('74', 332, 12, 20, 625756) I am glad too that Parulekar took the trouble of writing out his speech.
('74', 332, 12, 21, 625829) Though the sentences marked do not appear in the speech, there is hot stuff enough in it, perilously going near to the sentiments ascribed to Parulekar in the report I sent to you.
('74', 332, 12, 22, 626010) Mark the following:

('74', 340, 1, 2, 636550) 454. SPEECH AT SCOUTS RALLY 1
('74', 340, 2, 3, 636580) SEGAON, [December 22, 1938] 2
('74', 340, 3, 4, 636610) I congratulate you on the demonstration of the drill that you have given.
('74', 340, 3, 5, 636684) It is a necessary part of your training.
('74', 340, 3, 6, 636725) But while you have made a fine beginning, you have still much ground to traverse.
('74', 340, 3, 7, 636807) The object of mass drill is to enable large bodies of people to perform any movement rhythmically and swiftly and with absolute precision.
('74', 340, 3, 8, 636946) What a saving in national time and energy it would mean if we could do that in our public meetings and functions !
('74', 340, 3, 9, 637061) There is a silent music in disciplined movement of masses of men and women.
('74', 340, 3, 10, 637137) Just now I asked you to move a little towards me so that my low voice may reach you.
('74', 340, 3, 11, 637222) Had you advanced far enough in your drill, you would have been able to perform that movement with ease without any noise or confusion.
('74', 340, 3, 12, 637357) There is a rhythm and music in drill that makes action effortless and eliminates fatigue.
('74', 340, 3, 13, 637447) If the whole nation of 300 millions could be drilled so as to move together and act together and if necessary to die together as one man, we should attain indepen dence without striking a blow and set an example of a peaceful revo lution for the whole world to emulate.
('74', 340, 3, 14, 637717) I was particularly glad to note that the Khoja Boarding House at Wardha had sent its quota of scouts to participate in your rally.
('74', 340, 3, 15, 637848) This is as it should be.
('74', 340, 3, 16, 637873) Boy scouts’ training has been incorporated in the Wardha Scheme of Education.
('74', 340, 3, 17, 637951) It would be nothing worth if it did not serve to remove all mutual distrust and suspicion and foster among the various sections and communities a perfect spirit of camaraderie which is an integral part of that scheme, although it is not set down in so many words in the Zakir Husain Committee’s report.
('74', 340, 3, 18, 638254) The Wardha Scheme of Education does not aim merely at imparting literary train ing to the students; its object is to give an education for life that would answer the need of our millions.
('74', 340, 3, 19, 638442) It is calculated to be a living and life giving experiment.
('74', 340, 3, 20, 638502) Teachers, who have in their turn to become torch bearers of this education, have need, therefore, of a broader and
('74', 340, 4, 21, 638617) 1 Extracted from Pyarelal’s “Weekly Letter”.
('74', 340, 4, 22, 638662) The rally was held at the end of a 21 days’ training course in scoutcraft conducted at Wardha for pupil teachers under the Wardha Scheme of Education.
('74', 340, 4, 23, 638813) 2 The date is from The Hindu, 23 12 1938.
('74', 341, 0, 1, 638855) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 342
('74', 341, 1, 2, 638897) wider training.
('74', 341, 1, 3, 638913) And scoutcraft is an important and useful part of that training.
('74', 341, 1, 4, 638978) I know something of the work of the old Seva Samiti founded by Revered Malaviyaji.
('74', 341, 1, 5, 639061) I know also Pandit Hridayanath Kunzru’s work on it; and I have come in contact with Shri Bajpai, the organizer of the Samiti.
('74', 341, 1, 6, 639187) If, therefore, I offer a few remarks by way of sugges tions, they must be taken as those of a friend.
('74', 341, 1, 7, 639289) As I watched the flag salutation ceremony, there seemed to be an air of unreality about it.
('74', 341, 1, 8, 639381) Your song is composed in highflown language.
('74', 341, 1, 9, 639426) You have in that song expressed your readiness to lay down your lives for that flag which you have envisioned as one day floating over the whole world.
('74', 341, 1, 10, 639578) Could you seriously mean it, I asked myself, as you sang that song.
('74', 341, 1, 11, 639646) I venture to suggest that such sentiments as are expressed in that song may not be associated with any other than the national flag—if they are not to remain a mere pious wish calculated to begin and end with the singing of that song.
('74', 341, 1, 12, 639881) People cannot die for many flags.
('74', 341, 1, 13, 639915) If you must have a separate flag and a hoisting ceremony, your song should be pitched in a lower key.
('74', 341, 1, 14, 640017) Then, again, I see you have your inscription on the flag in English.
('74', 341, 1, 15, 640086) That seems to me an anomaly.
('74', 341, 1, 16, 640115) You should have on your flag Hindustani inscription.
('74', 341, 1, 17, 640168) Scouting must aim not merely at the training of the body but that of the brain and heart too.
('74', 341, 1, 18, 640262) It would be a poor performance if it confines itself to mere externals and ignores the internal.
('74', 341, 1, 19, 640359) A word to the pupil teachers who are assembled here.
('74', 341, 1, 20, 640412) As the first batch, on them rests a heavy responsibility.
('74', 341, 1, 21, 640470) It is not merely they but the scheme of education which they are out to work that is going to be put on its trial.
('74', 341, 1, 22, 640585) It therefore behoves them to be punctilious and exact in every little thing that they say or do.
('74', 341, 1, 23, 640682) They must weigh every word that they utter and take care never to utter a word in vain.
('74', 341, 1, 24, 640770) It is a new and untried experiment that they are going to launch upon, i.e., to give the whole education through a craft.
('74', 341, 1, 25, 640892) Success will be the reward of unremitting exercise of intelligence in all their acts.
('74', 341, 1, 26, 640978) Nothing will be more detrimental to it than insincerity in speech, thought or action.

('74', 342, 1, 2, 641132) 455. LETTER TO LORD LINLITHGOW
('74', 342, 2, 3, 641163) SEGAON, WARDHA, December 23, 1938
('74', 342, 3, 4, 641197) DEAR LORD LINLITHGOW, I find that Residents in certain States are discouraging Ruling Chiefs from having any dealings with Congressmen such as Sardar Patel.
('74', 342, 3, 5, 641354) I have unimpeachable evidence in two cases.
('74', 342, 3, 6, 641398) Of these I am free to mention one.
('74', 342, 3, 7, 641433) That is in connection with Rajkot.
('74', 342, 3, 8, 641468) I do not wish to tax you with details.
('74', 342, 3, 9, 641507) I hope it is not the intention at the headquarters to discourage ruling Chiefs from cultivating friendly relations with Congressmen.The States people have always looked to the Congress for guidance and advice.
('74', 342, 3, 10, 641717) With increasing awakening among the States people, there should be no wonder if Chiefs seek Congress advice and assistance in settling their differences with their people.
('74', 342, 3, 11, 641889) Discourage ment by Residents amounts to orders to them.
('74', 342, 3, 12, 641945) Recent declarations in London seem to show that there is no intention, on the part of the superior authority, to interfere with the Chiefs in such matters.
('74', 342, 3, 13, 642101) If my impression is correct and if on enquiry you find that the statement I have made about Rajkot is borne out, may I expect that you will instruct Residents in general not to interfere with the Ruling Chiefs who may choose to seek the assistance of Congressmen in solving the difficulties that face them?
('74', 342, 5, 14, 642408) Yours sincerely, M. K. GANDHI

('74', 342, 6, 16, 642476) 107. Courtesy: National Archives of India

('74', 344, 1, 2, 644020) 459. LETTER TO BALWANTSINHA
('74', 344, 2, 3, 644048) SEGAON, December 23, 1938
('74', 344, 3, 4, 644074) BALWANTSINHA, I have gone through your letter carefully.
('74', 344, 3, 5, 644131) It is good.
('74', 344, 3, 6, 644143) But I notice that you cannot bear to be separated from the cows.
('74', 344, 3, 7, 644208) You should take it that the separation is in the interest of greater service to the cow.
('74', 344, 3, 8, 644297) I shall gain some experience and so will you.
('74', 344, 3, 9, 644343) You have doubts as to the propriety of what is being done.
('74', 344, 3, 10, 644402) It is not right.
('74', 344, 3, 11, 644419) For if you have doubts it denotes a lack of knowledge behind your renun ciation.
('74', 344, 3, 12, 644500) From what you told me yesterday I thought your heart was cleansed and you had realized that what was being done was all to the good.
('74', 344, 3, 13, 644633) I never attributed to you any baseness of spirit.
('74', 344, 3, 14, 644683) I did mention your pride and that too by way of praise.
('74', 344, 3, 15, 644739) I even said that in your devotion to the cow you have no equal, not even Parnerkar, and the same applied to your capacity for hard labour.
('74', 344, 3, 16, 644878) Your experience too is considerable, for you have been familiar with agriculture and cattle keeping from childhood.
('74', 344, 3, 17, 644994) But I also said that notwithstanding all this your knowledge was not systematic or scientific and consequently you would not be able to make further progress in animal husbandry and that your anger would consume you as well as the cow.
('74', 344, 3, 18, 645230) At the same time I asked Parnerkar to examine his heart and to take posse ssion of the dairy only if he was confident of himself.
('74', 344, 3, 19, 645360) He has been given charge only under this stipulation and these conditions.
('74', 344, 3, 20, 645435) I have had a talk with Nayakumji.
('74', 344, 3, 21, 645469) He will discuss the matter with you.
('74', 344, 3, 22, 645506) Do not commit yourself definitely to any work for the present.
('74', 344, 3, 23, 645569) Have a little rest; give some quiet thought to what has been and is being done; read and ponder a little and do whatever Ashram tasks naturally come your way.
('74', 344, 3, 24, 645728) Consult Chimanlal and take up any job for which he is hard pressed.
('74', 344, 3, 25, 645796) There can never be any want of work in our institution for a worker like you.

('74', 347, 6, 17, 650425) 464. INTERVIEW TO H. V. HODSON 1
('74', 347, 7, 18, 650458) [Before December 25, 1938] 2
('74', 347, 8, 19, 650487) Mr. Hodson expressed the opinion that the solution of the Hindu Muslim question was made difficult by the fact that, owing to its very nature, the Congress tended to take on the nature of a “totalitarian party” and acted as if it were the one and the only party in the country that mattered, instead of regarding itself simply as one of the principal parties.
('74', 347, 9, 20, 650847) GANDHIJI: It is a very wrong view to take of the Congress.
('74', 347, 9, 21, 650906) The Con gress does claim to be the one and the only party that can deliver the goods.
('74', 347, 9, 22, 650992) It is a perfectly valid claim to make.
('74', 347, 9, 23, 651031) One day or the other some party has to assert itself to that extent.
('74', 347, 9, 24, 651100) That does not make it a totalitarian party.
('74', 347, 9, 25, 651144) It is the ambition of the Congress to become all re 
('74', 347, 10, 26, 651197) 1 Extracted from Pyarelal’s “Weekly Letter” dated December 25. H. V. Hodson was the editor of Round Table.
('74', 348, 0, 1, 651304) VOL. 74: 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 349
('74', 348, 1, 2, 651352) presentative of the entire nation, not merely of any particular section.
('74', 348, 1, 3, 651425) And it is a worthy ambition in keeping with its best tradition.
('74', 348, 1, 4, 651489) If you have studied Congress history, you will find that since its very inception the Congress has sought to serve and represent all sections in the country equally without any distinction or discrimination.
('74', 348, 1, 5, 651697) Thus it used to have Rajas and Maharajas on the Reception Committee, and has defended the cause of the States against the Paramount Power as in the case of Kashmir and Mysore.
('74', 348, 1, 6, 651873) It would love to be absorbed by the Muslim League if the Muslim League would care to absorb it, or to absorb the Muslim League in its turn, so far as the political programme is concerned.
('74', 348, 1, 7, 652061) For religious and social activity, of course, every community can have its separate organization.
('74', 348, 2, 8, 652159) HODSON: But if the Congress has the ambition of absorbing other political organizations, it cannot help being a totalitarian party.
('74', 348, 3, 9, 652291) GANDHIJI: You may try to damn it by calling it totalitarian.
('74', 348, 3, 10, 652352) Absorption is inevitable when a country is engaged in a struggle to wrest power from foreign hands; it cannot afford to have separate, rival political organizations.
('74', 348, 3, 11, 652518) The entire strength of the country must be used for ousting the third and usurping party.
('74', 348, 3, 12, 652608) That is what is happening in India today.
('74', 348, 3, 13, 652650) Where there is no common danger to oppose, there must be separate parties representing different schools of thought.
('74', 348, 3, 14, 652767) You should bear in mind that the Congress does not im pose its will on others.
('74', 348, 3, 15, 652846) Its sanctions are non violent.
('74', 348, 4, 16, 652877) HODSON: Would not the march to full responsible government be more rapid if the Muslims were taken along?
('74', 348, 5, 17, 652983) GANDHIJI: Of course it would be.
('74', 348, 5, 18, 653016) Personally I do not want any thing which the Muslims oppose.
('74', 348, 5, 19, 653077) But I have faith that the solution of the Hindu Muslim tangle will come much sooner than most people expect.
('74', 348, 5, 20, 653186) I claim to be able to look at the whole position with a detached mind.
('74', 348, 5, 21, 653257) There is no substance in our quarrels.
('74', 348, 5, 22, 653296) Points of difference are superficial, those of contact are deep and permanent.
('74', 348, 5, 23, 653375) Political and economic subjection is common to us.
('74', 348, 5, 24, 653426) The same climate, the same rivers, the same fields supply both with air, water and food.
('74', 348, 5, 25, 653515) Whatever, therefore, leaders, Mahatmas and Maulanas may say or do, the masses, when they are fully awakened, will assert themselves and combine for the sake of combating common evils.
('74', 348, 5, 26, 653699) The effect of the Socialist and Communist propaganda too is to bring the masses of both the communities together by emphasizing identity of interests.
('74', 348, 5, 27, 653850) I have my differences with them, but I cannot
('74', 349, 0, 1, 653896) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 350
('74', 349, 1, 2, 653938) withhold my admiration for their endeavour to demolish the supers tition that keeps the different communities apart.

('74', 349, 6, 18, 655193) It is in praise of the spinning wheel.
('74', 349, 6, 19, 655232) It runs as follows:
('74', 349, 7, 20, 655252) It is after a long time that I have found such leisure to work on the spinning wheel.
('74', 349, 7, 21, 655338) And when I can spin so peacefully, I do not need anything else.
('74', 349, 7, 22, 655402) I find incomparable joy in this.
('74', 349, 7, 23, 655435) I feel that I should spin enough to make up for the many days when I could not spin.
('74', 349, 7, 24, 655520) We do not come across many persons who combine so well in themselves love of the spinning wheel, sacrifice, devotion to one’s father and courage of the highest order.
('74', 349, 7, 25, 655687) But, when I do come across one, my heart dances with joy.

('74', 351, 3, 17, 659949) 468. STUDENTS’ SHAME
('74', 351, 4, 18, 659970) There is a most pathetic letter from a college girl in the Punjab lying on my file for nearly two months.
('74', 351, 4, 19, 660076) Want of time was but an excuse for shirking the answer to the girl’s question.
('74', 351, 4, 20, 660155) Somehow or other I was avoiding the task, though I knew the answer.
('74', 351, 4, 21, 660223) Meanwhile I received another letter from a sister of great experience, and I felt that I could no longer evade the duty of dealing with the college girl’s very real difficulty.
('74', 351, 4, 22, 660400) Her letter is written in chaste Hindustani.
('74', 352, 0, 1, 660444) VOL. 74: 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 353
('74', 352, 1, 2, 660492) try to do as much justice as I can to the letter, which gives me a perfect picture of her deep feeling.
('74', 352, 1, 3, 660596) Here is my rendering of a portion of the letter: To girls and grown up women there come times, in spite of their wish to the contrary, when they have to venture out alone, whether they are going from one place to another in the same city or from one town to another.
('74', 352, 1, 4, 660863) And when they are thus found alone, evil minded people pester them.
('74', 352, 1, 5, 660931) They use im proper or even indecent language whilst they are passing by.
('74', 352, 1, 6, 661004) And if fear does not check them, they do not hesitate to take further liberty.
('74', 352, 1, 7, 661083) I should like to know what part non violence can play on such occasions.
('74', 352, 1, 8, 661156) The use of violence is of course there.
('74', 352, 1, 9, 661196) If the girl or the woman has sufficient courage, she will use what resources she has and teach miscreants a lesson.
('74', 352, 1, 10, 661312) They can at least kick up a row that would draw the attention of the people around, resulting in the miscreants being horse whipped.
('74', 352, 1, 11, 661445) But I know that the result of such treatment would be merely to postpone the agony, not a permanent cure.
('74', 352, 1, 12, 661551) Where you know the people who misbehave, I feel sure that they will listen to reason, to the gesture of love and humility.
('74', 352, 1, 13, 661674) But what about a fellow cycling by, using foul language on seeing a girl or a woman unaccompanied by a male companion?
('74', 352, 1, 14, 661793) You have no oppor tunity of reasoning with him.
('74', 352, 1, 15, 661841) There is no likelihood of your meeting him again.
('74', 352, 1, 16, 661891) You may not even recognize him.
('74', 352, 1, 17, 661923) You do not know his address.
('74', 352, 1, 18, 661952) What is a poor girl or a woman to do in such cases?
('74', 352, 1, 19, 662004) By way of example I want to give you my own experience of last night (26th October).

('74', 379, 1, 2, 711776) 502. ENLIGHTENED ANARCHY—A POLITICAL IDEAL
('74', 379, 2, 3, 711819) Political power, in my opinion, cannot be our ultimate aim.
('74', 379, 2, 4, 711879) It is one of the means used by men for their all round advancement.
('74', 379, 2, 5, 711947) The power to control national life through national representatives is called political power.
('74', 379, 2, 6, 712042) Representatives will become unnecessary if the natio nal life becomes so perfect as to be self controlled.
('74', 379, 2, 7, 712149) It will then be a state of enlightened anarchy in which each person will become his own ruler.
('74', 379, 2, 8, 712244) He will conduct himself in such a way that his behaviour will not hamper the well being of his neighbours.
('74', 379, 2, 9, 712351) In an ideal State there will be no political institution and therefore no political power.
('74', 379, 2, 10, 712442) That is why Thoreau has said in his classic statement that that govern ment is the best which governs the least.

('74', 379, 6, 14, 712665) FRYDMAN: What attitude should I, as a realist, adopt with regard to the tide of industrialization that is sweeping over the world?.

('74', 379, 6, 16, 712844) Would it not be better to try to change its direction ?
('74', 379, 7, 17, 712900) GANDHIJI: You are an engineer.
('74', 379, 7, 18, 712931) You will therefore appreciate an illustration from mechanics.
('74', 379, 7, 19, 712993) You know the parallelogram of forces.
('74', 379, 7, 20, 713031) There the forces do not neutralize each other.
('74', 379, 7, 21, 713078) Each force acts freely along its own line and we get the resultant which indicates the final direction of motion.
('74', 379, 7, 22, 713192) It is the same with the problem you have men tioned.
('74', 379, 7, 23, 713245) As I look at Russia where the apotheosis of industriazation has been reached, the life there does not appeal to me.
('74', 379, 7, 24, 713361) To use the language of the Bible, “What shall it avail a man if he gain the whole world and lose his soul?” In modern terms, it is beneath human dignity to lose one’s individuality and become a mere cog in the machine.
('74', 379, 7, 25, 713580) I want every individual to become a full blooded, fully

('74', 382, 2, 3, 718170) [January 1, 1939] 2
('74', 382, 3, 4, 718190) The Chinese delegates put searching questions.
('74', 382, 3, 5, 718237) One of them asked: “Is it not necessary that individuals should practise non violence first in their own person, in their relations with other individuals?”
('74', 382, 4, 6, 718394) GANDHIJI: It would be a delusion to think otherwise.
('74', 382, 4, 7, 718447) If one does not practise non violence in one’s personal relations with others and hopes to use it in bigger affairs, one is vastly mistaken.
('74', 382, 4, 8, 718588) Non violence like charity must begin at home.
('74', 382, 4, 9, 718634) But if it is necessary for the individual to be trained in non violence, it is even more necessary for the nation to be trained likewise.
('74', 382, 4, 10, 718772) One cannot be non violent in one’s own circle and violent outside it.
('74', 382, 4, 11, 718842) Or else, one is not truly non violent even in one’s own circle; often the non violence is only in appea rance.
('74', 382, 4, 12, 718953) It is only when you meet with resistance, as for instance when a thief or murderer appears, that your non violence is put on its trial.
('74', 382, 4, 13, 719089) You either try or should try to oppose the thief with his own weapons, or you try to disarm’ him by love.
('74', 382, 4, 14, 719195) Living among decent people, your conduct may not be described as non violent.
('74', 382, 4, 15, 719273) Mutual forbearance is not non violence.
('74', 382, 4, 16, 719313) Immediately, therefore, you get the conviction that non violence is the law of life, you have to practise it towards those who act violently towards you, and the law must apply to nations as to individuals.
('74', 382, 4, 17, 719520) Training is no doubt necessary.
('74', 382, 4, 18, 719552) And beginnings are always small.
('74', 382, 4, 19, 719585) But if the conviction is there, the rest will follow.
('74', 382, 5, 20, 719639) Q. In the practice of non violence, is there not danger of developing a ‘martyrdom complex’ or pride creeping in?
('74', 382, 6, 21, 719753) A. If one has that pride and egoism, there is no non violence.
('74', 382, 6, 22, 719816) Non violence is impossible without humility.
('74', 382, 6, 23, 719861) My own experience is that whenever I have acted non violently I have been led to it and sustained in it by the higher promptings of an unseen Power.
('74', 382, 6, 24, 720010) Through my own will I should have miserably failed.
('74', 382, 6, 25, 720062) When I first went to jail, I quailed at the prospect.
('74', 382, 6, 26, 720116) I had heard terrible things about jail life.

('74', 391, 1, 3, 740800) If that were so, one would have supposed that he would have paid tribute to such men as Herr von Ossietzky 1. Courage to a Nazi, however, seems a virtue only when displayed by his own supporters: elsewhere it becomes the impudent provocation of Jewish Marxist canaille.

('74', 391, 1, 7, 741537) I do not think that the sufferings of Pastor Niemoeller and others have been in vain.
('74', 391, 1, 8, 741623) They have preserved their self respect intact.
('74', 391, 1, 9, 741670) They have proved that their faith was equal to any suffering.
('74', 391, 1, 10, 741732) That they have not proved sufficient for melting Herr Hitler’s heart merely shows that it is made of a harder material than stone.
('74', 391, 1, 11, 741863) But the hardest metal yields to sufficient heat.
('74', 391, 1, 12, 741912) Even so must the hardest heart melt before sufficiency of the heat of non violence.
('74', 391, 1, 13, 741996) And there is no limit to the capacity of non violence to generate heat.
('74', 391, 1, 14, 742068) Every action is a resultant of a multitude of forces even of a contrary nature.
('74', 391, 1, 15, 742148) There is no waste of energy.
('74', 391, 1, 16, 742177) So we learn in the books on mechanics.
('74', 391, 1, 17, 742216) This is equally true of human actions.
('74', 391, 1, 18, 742255) The difference is that in the one case we generally know the forces at work, and when we do, we can mathematically foretell the resultant.
('74', 391, 1, 19, 742394) In the case of human actions, they result from a concurrence of forces of most of which we have no knowledge.
('74', 391, 1, 20, 742504) But our ignorance must not be made to serve the cause of disbelief in the power of these forces.
('74', 391, 1, 21, 742601) Rather is our ignorance a cause for greater faith.
('74', 391, 1, 22, 742652) And non violence being the mightiest force in the world and also the most elusive in its working, it demands the greatest exercise of faith.
('74', 391, 1, 23, 742793) Even as we believe in God in faith, so have we to believe in non violence in faith.
('74', 391, 1, 24, 742877) Herr Hitler is but one man enjoying no more than the average span of life.

('74', 396, 1, 2, 749252) 518. DRAFT OF PRESS STATEMENT FOR JAMNALAL BAJAJ 1
('74', 396, 2, 3, 749303) BARDOLI, January 7, 1939
('74', 396, 3, 4, 749328) Rumours have been going the round as to what I am going to do about the ban on my entry into Jaipur State—my birth place and ancestral home.
('74', 396, 3, 5, 749469) The ban is as much a surprise to me as to my friends.
('74', 396, 3, 6, 749523) My whole life has been passed in the interests of peace in all walks of life.
('74', 396, 3, 7, 749601) Whatever else non violence may be with Congressmen it is my creed and I try as much as it is in my power to live up to it.
('74', 396, 3, 8, 749724) I am no enemy of States.
('74', 396, 3, 9, 749749) I have always maintained a friendly attitude towards them.
('74', 396, 3, 10, 749808) I have always believed the States to be capable of responding to the new awakening that has taken place in India.
('74', 396, 3, 11, 749922) I am now carrying on correspondence with a view to find out the secret lying behind the ban.
('74', 396, 3, 12, 750015) The wording of the order in no sense applies to me.
('74', 396, 3, 13, 750067) I do not wish to act in haste.
('74', 396, 3, 14, 750098) I have no desire to embarrass the Jaipur State authorities.
('74', 396, 3, 15, 750158) But if every honourable effort to have the ban removed fails the public may depend upon my doing my duty.
('74', 396, 3, 16, 750264) My present and immediate object is to afford through the Mandal 2 relief to the famine stricken in Jaipur State.
('74', 396, 3, 17, 750377) I hope that the ban will not be allowed to disturb the would be donors.
('74', 396, 3, 18, 750449) I am making arrangements for all eventualities.
('74', 396, 3, 19, 750497) Indeed my main reason for going to Jaipur was to devise measures for famine relief.
('74', 396, 3, 20, 750581) My second immediate concern is to try to secure the release of the nine prisoners during the recent crisis in Sikar.
('74', 396, 3, 21, 750698) One of them is convicted and eight are still awaiting trial.
('74', 396, 3, 22, 750759) I had good grounds for hoping that they would come in for general amnesty.
('74', 396, 3, 23, 750834) I can only assure them that I shall leave no stone unturned to secure their release while I am still free.

('74', 397, 4, 5, 751189) SIR, The attached order dated 16th December last was served on me on the 28th of the same month at Sawai Madhopur whilst I was on my way to Jaipur.
('74', 397, 4, 6, 751337) The order came as a painful surprise to me.
('74', 397, 4, 7, 751381) At the station I had over an hour’s chat with Mr.F.S.Young,I.G.P.,who was persuading me not to commit a breach of the order.
('74', 397, 4, 8, 751506) I did not need much persuasion as in a discussion with Gandhiji, of the possibility of such an order being served on me, he had advised me not to break the order immediately but to consider the whole situation in consultation with him before taking any final step.
('74', 397, 4, 9, 751771) Accordingly I suspended my journey and proceeded to Delhi.
('74', 397, 4, 10, 751830) After having conferred with friends and fellow workers and finally Gandhiji, I have come to the conclusion that on the 1st of February next I should commit a breach of the order unless, before then, it is unconditionally revoked.
('74', 397, 4, 11, 752060) The authorities know that a public appeal was issued by me on 1st November last on behalf of the Jaipur Rajya Praja Mandal, of which I am President, that as famine had overtaken Shekhawati and other areas, relief work was to be undertaken by the Mandal to the ex clusion of all other activity.
('74', 397, 4, 12, 752354) They were also aware that on a news paper report having appeared to the effect that civil disobedience was to be started in Jaipur I had issued a flat contradiction.
('74', 397, 4, 13, 752520) I do not know what had happened on or before the 16th December to warrant the passing of the order in anticipation of my seeking to enter Jaipur State.

('74', 398, 1, 4, 753288) Surely if the authorities had any fear of my leading such a movement, they might have at least ascertained from me as to the truth or otherwise of the information in their possession.
('74', 398, 1, 5, 753472) They knew me sufficiently to feel sure that I would not conceal the truth from them.
('74', 398, 1, 6, 753557) Indeed the authorities know I rendered help to them also during the recent crisis in Sikar consistently with my obligations to the people.
('74', 398, 1, 7, 753696) They know that my offices were used entirely on behalf of peace.
('74', 398, 1, 8, 753761) My surprise may therefore be better imagined than I can describe it when I learnt from the order that “your (my) presence and activities are likely to lead to a breach of the peace”, and that, therefore, “it is considered necessary in the public interest and for the maintenance of public tranquillity to prohibit your (my) entry within the Jaipur State.” I have no hesitation in saying that the notice belies the whole of my public career.
('74', 398, 1, 9, 754202) I observe that I have been described as of Wardha.
('74', 398, 1, 10, 754253) I hope this is a slip.
('74', 398, 1, 11, 754276) For the Jaipur State, surely I am of Jaipur.

('74', 398, 1, 14, 754499) The Praja Mandal was started in July of 1931 and reorganized in November 1936. It has a constitution.
('74', 398, 1, 15, 754601) It has many distinguished men of Jaipur State as its members.
('74', 398, 1, 16, 754663) It has hitherto carried on its acti vities within the four corners of the Jaipur law and submitted even to irksome and illiberal restrictions regarding meetings and processions.
('74', 398, 1, 17, 754841) But the order served on me has opened the eyes of the Mandal.
('74', 398, 1, 18, 754903) It has come to the conclusion that it must resort to civil disobedience if civil liberty is not guaranteed and meetings and processions and forming of associations are not allowed without let or hindrance so long as they observe strict non violence.
('74', 398, 1, 19, 755153) I should define the scope of our activity.
('74', 398, 1, 20, 755196) There is no mistake as to our goal.
('74', 398, 1, 21, 755232) We want responsible government under the aegis of the Maharaja.
('74', 398, 1, 22, 755296) We must therefore tell the people what it is and what they should do to deserve it.
('74', 398, 1, 23, 755380) But we do not propose to offer civil disobe dience for it.

('74', 399, 1, 4, 755703) If we secure the co ope ration of the State in our essentially peaceful and life building activi ties and in the redress of admitted grievances there never need be any resort to non payment of taxes.

('74', 401, 3, 5, 758946) 524. UNCERTIFIED DEALERS 1
('74', 401, 4, 6, 758973) The Secretary of the Tamil Nad Spinners’ Association has sent us a complaint which he has received from the Kerala Branch of the Spinners’ Association.
('74', 401, 4, 7, 759125) The complaint gives conclusive proof that some merchants of Tiruppur are dumping cloth under description ‘shuddha khadi’ and even making use of the name of the Spinners’ Association.
('74', 401, 4, 8, 759308) Two labels have been sent by the Secretary which were affixed to the cloth thus sold, and the labels show the names of ‘S. Mariasusai Chettiar, Khaddar Store, Tiruppur’ and ‘M. K. Chidamba ram Chettiar and Brother A. Palaniappa Mudaliar, Khaddar Store, Ti ruppur’, and the description is ‘shuddha khadi, certified by A.I.S. A’.
('74', 401, 4, 9, 759636) S. Mariasusai Chettiar has never been certified by the A. I. S. A. for dealing in khadi, and A. Palaniappa Mudaliar was decertified some four years ago.
('74', 401, 4, 10, 759789) Such deception can certainly be punished under the ordinary Indian Penal Code.
('74', 401, 4, 11, 759868) It would, however, be much better for the merchants as well as for the public if the public demand for khadi were not thus exploited, and if merchants who have not been certified abstain from such business, or at least abstain from fraudulently using the name of the Spinners’ Association.
('74', 401, 4, 12, 760158) BARDOLI, January 8, 1939 Harijan, 14 1 1939

('74', 402, 3, 10, 761389) 526. TRAVANCORE
('74', 402, 4, 11, 761405) A Travancore Christian friend writes:
('74', 402, 5, 12, 761443) There is a great misunderstanding about you among the Christian circles of Travancore that you are absolutely against the interests of Christians, and this has originated since you have begun to insist on the withdrawal of the memorial to the Maharaja.
('74', 402, 5, 13, 761696) The trend of public opinion as has been expressed to me by many friends is something like this: By the influence of the Travancore Maharani and Sir C. P. Ramaswami Iyer you are wrongly made to understand that the present movement in Travancore is only a rising of the Christians for absolute supremacy over the Hindus of Travancore.
('74', 402, 5, 14, 762029) It is with this impression in the background of your mind that you are today working against the Travancore movement.
('74', 402, 5, 15, 762147) Besides, due to the famous temple entry proclamation, Sir C. P. Ramaswami Iyer has done agreat service to the Hindu community as a whole, and therefore you want to save him from any blemish and personal charges, whatever be his shortcomings.
('74', 402, 5, 16, 762389) It is with this end in view that you are so strongly pressing the State Congress to withdraw the memorial.
('74', 402, 5, 17, 762496) Otherwise there is no reason why you should adopt one policy for Rajkot and another for Travancore.
('74', 402, 5, 18, 762596) For in the case of Rajkot Vallabhbhai Patel and many others have made so many personal charges against the Dewan, and recently Vallabhbhai even threatened to start another fight for the removal of the present Dewan.
('74', 402, 5, 19, 762812) You simply approve of all this.
('74', 402, 5, 20, 762844) While in the case of Travancore, even though it is absolutely impossible for you to understand the situation on the spot being so far off, you simply dictate terms on the memorial question and keep mum over all the unjust actions of the Government.
('74', 402, 5, 21, 763093) Even after the memorial has been withdrawn the leaders are kept in prison and arrests are being continued in large numbers, and peopleare terrorized all over the State even though the movement is almost dead.
('74', 402, 5, 22, 763302) All this you view in silence without uttering a word.
('74', 402, 5, 23, 763356) This is a further evidence of your partiality in siding with the Travancore

('74', 415, 8, 18, 789719) 539. VIOLENCE V. NON VIOLENCE
('74', 415, 9, 19, 789749) Everywhere in India there is a duel going on between the method of non violence and that of violence.
('74', 415, 9, 20, 789851) Violence like water, when it has an outlet, rushes forward furiously with an overwhelming force.
('74', 415, 9, 21, 789948) Non violence cannot act madly.
('74', 415, 9, 22, 789979) It is the essence of discipline.
('74', 415, 9, 23, 790012) But when it is set going, no amount of violence can crush it.
('74', 415, 9, 24, 790074) For full play, it requires unsullied purity and an unquenchable faith among the leaders.

('74', 421, 10, 26, 800810) 548. LOVE A UNIVERSAL VIRTUE
('74', 421, 11, 27, 800839) An Indian Christian writes: 1
('74', 421, 12, 28, 800869) Your article “The Jews” 2 has evoked considerable comment of varying nature.
('74', 421, 12, 29, 800946) I propose to confine myself to the criticism that the love that Jesus taught was a personal, not a social or collective, virtue.
('74', 421, 13, 30, 801075) To deny that Jesus’ way of life was meant for all—collectively no less than individually—is surely to deny the basic truth of the religion of Christ.
('74', 421, 14, 31, 801225) 1 Only extracts from the letter are reproduced here.
('74', 421, 14, 32, 801278) 2 Vide “The Jews”
('74', 422, 0, 1, 801296) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 423
('74', 422, 1, 2, 801345) He was utterly dissatisfied with the existing order; the hypocrisy and pride of the Scribes and Pharisees riled him sufficiently for him to call them a ‘generation of vipers’ and ‘whited sepulchres’; he openly protested against bribery and corruption when he ‘upset the tables of the money changers’ and accused them of having made his house ‘a den of thieves’; he denounced the sin of untouchability by dining with outcastes and speaking words of comfort to prostitutes.
('74', 422, 2, 3, 801817) His preaching roused the anger of the people because it was revolutionary and universal; otherwise why should those in authority have cared to arrest and condemn to the extreme penalty of the law a man in whom even the judge who tried him could find no ‘sin’?
('74', 422, 3, 4, 802077) They sensed in his teachings a power which, if exercised by those who believed in them, would surely cause to fall the whole framework of their society.
('74', 422, 3, 5, 802230) To ‘turn the other cheek’ to him who smites you on one, to love the enemy, to rejoice in suffering, to love your neighbour as yourself, to remove the beam from your own eye before pointing to the mote in another’s, to pray for those who persecute you, to forgive the offender until seventy times seven, to serve the poor, to leave all and follow Jesus, are of the essence of a universal gospel for which he lived and died.
('74', 422, 3, 6, 802653) That he asked his disciples to let the world see this message by virtue of their own example, that the disciples themselves felt the call to recreate a new order, bears ample evidence in the very formation, through their martyrdom, of the early Church which is termed to be the body of Christ.
('74', 422, 3, 7, 802947) One of the most beautiful passages in the New Testament, the 13th Chapter of I Corinthians, was written by St. Paul at a time when the Church of Corinth was torn by internal dissensions.
('74', 422, 3, 8, 803134) The message of love therein was the message for collective action.
('74', 422, 3, 9, 803201) The ‘Church Militant’, as it is called, is surely the emblem of Christian society trying to war against the powers of evil by means of love which ‘conquers all things’.
('74', 422, 4, 10, 803370) But while it may be convenient, because of the lack of courage and faith within us, to set aside the central teaching of the religion of Christ as a mere rule for personal conduct, it is a dangerous doctrine which has brought the so called Christian nations to a sorry pass today.
('74', 422, 5, 11, 803651) No doubt the result of non violence is not always visible to the naked eye.
('74', 422, 5, 12, 803727) That the way of love—for what is non violence except boundless love— is not easy to pursue is only too true.
('74', 422, 5, 13, 803836) But to rule love out as a social virtue is to deny the existence of not only the religion of Jesus but of all the great religions of the world and to give way to fear which is the ruling passion in the world today.
('74', 422, 6, 14, 804051) Non violence on a national or international scale has not yet been sufficiently tried; where it has been tried by Gandhiji it has met with success.
('74', 422, 6, 15, 804199) Is not Europe, by subordinating her mind to the doctrine that ‘Might is Right’, giving a direct lie to the teaching of Jesus ?
('74', 422, 6, 16, 804326) This is the question before
('74', 423, 0, 1, 804354) 424 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 423, 1, 2, 804396) Christendom today.
('74', 423, 1, 3, 804415) Does the greatest measure of freedom consist in being able to resist force with the weapons of force, or may it not be that its highest and eternal form will be born out of the blood willingly shed by one nation or many nations?
('74', 423, 1, 4, 804644) Oh cross that liftest up my head,
('74', 423, 2, 5, 804678) I may not ask to flee from thee,
('74', 423, 3, 6, 804711) I lay in dust, life’s glory dead.
('74', 423, 4, 7, 804745) And from the ground there blossoms red
('74', 423, 5, 8, 804784) Life that shall endless be.

('74', 425, 1, 6, 809075) If my argument has any substance in it, I repeat the request for the discharge of all the State Congress prisoners and for permission for the State Congress to pursue such activities, political or otherwise, that are constitutional.
('74', 425, 1, 7, 809308) I hope this finds you in the possession of the best of health.

('74', 434, 7, 16, 821945) 568. THE STATES
('74', 434, 8, 17, 821961) The movement for liberty within the States is entering a new stage.
('74', 434, 8, 18, 822029) History is going to repeat itself.
('74', 434, 8, 19, 822064) Talcher and Dhenkanal have led the way in repression.
('74', 434, 8, 20, 822118) It is no small matter that 26,000 out of 75,000 all told have migrated from Talcher to British Orissa.
('74', 434, 8, 21, 822221) Ranga has published harrowing details of the sufferings of these refugees.
('74', 434, 8, 22, 822296) His narrative is supported by Thakkar Bapa, the great social reformer and philanthropist, who responds to the call of distress no matter from what quarter it comes.
('74', 434, 8, 23, 822461) They have been in exile for two months.
('74', 434, 8, 24, 822501) I had hoped that they would have returned to their homes.
('74', 434, 8, 25, 822559) But there seems to be no peace for these people as yet.
('74', 434, 8, 26, 822615) It is not possible for Orissa alone to tackle the relief work.

('74', 436, 3, 9, 826043) 569. INTERNAL DECAY
('74', 436, 4, 10, 826063) My time and that of co workers is largely taken up in wading through complaints about corruption among Congressmen.
('74', 436, 4, 11, 826179) The latest typical letter received is from a Bombay Congressman: 1
('74', 436, 5, 12, 826246) Tripuri Congress delegates’ elections took place last Sunday in Bombay.
('74', 436, 5, 13, 826318) The voting was to start at 8 a.
('74', 436, 5, 14, 826350) in the morning.
('74', 436, 5, 15, 826366) I reached Congress House at nearly 8.45 a.
('74', 436, 5, 16, 826409) m., but to my consternation I found that I had already been impersonated in the short span of forty five minutes.
('74', 436, 5, 17, 826523) Scores of others had the same experience.
('74', 436, 5, 18, 826565) I tried to trace the source, and though (as expected) I could not trace the miscreant I found that this impersonation business was regularly organized and practised on a mass scale as soon as the polling had started.
('74', 436, 5, 19, 826782) Naturally those who came even half an hour late were disappointed, they having been impersonated meanwhile.
('74', 436, 6, 20, 826890) Many suggestions have been made to you to abate this nuisance, but in my humble opinion unless we introduce the system of asking the prospective voters to produce their membership cards to be duly stamped by the issuing officers before slips are issued to them, nothing will do the trick .
('74', 436, 6, 21, 827180) The correspondent’s suggestion is quite sound.
('74', 436, 6, 22, 827227) I should have thought that every voter had to produce an identification card before being allowed to register his vote.
('74', 436, 6, 23, 827347) My purpose, however, in reproducing the correspondent’s letter is not merely to draw attention to the impersonation in Bombay and the method of dealing with it.
('74', 436, 6, 24, 827508) The letter is a pointer.
('74', 436, 6, 25, 827533) Besides imper sonation there is the wholesale tampering with the Congress registers which contain bogus names.
('74', 436, 6, 26, 827644) These registers have as much value as a box containing counterfeit coins though it is claimed to contain rupees.
('74', 436, 6, 27, 827757) Strife at Congress elections is becoming a common occur rence.
('74', 436, 6, 28, 827820) The indiscipline of Congressmen is on the increase everywhere.

('74', 438, 1, 2, 830318) 570. ‘WHAT A MAN OF GOD!’
('74', 438, 2, 3, 830344) The much travelled Miss Muriel Lester, my East End hostess during the Round Table days, who is in the Frontier Province at the time of writing this, having met Badshah Khan, thus writes of him:
('74', 438, 3, 4, 830538) Now I have got to know Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan, I feel there is not likely to be another such honour in my life so far as meeting wonderful people goes.
('74', 438, 3, 5, 830691) He is an Old Testament prince with the New Testament gentleness.
('74', 438, 3, 6, 830756) What a man of God !
('74', 438, 3, 7, 830776) Thank you for making it possible for us to know him.
('74', 438, 4, 8, 830829) He is taking us tomorrow to Utmanzai.
('74', 438, 4, 9, 830867) It will be a pleasure to see Mira again.
('74', 438, 4, 10, 830908) I would not have published this private testimony if I had thought it to be the exaggeration of an unbalanced mind.
('74', 438, 4, 11, 831024) It is true that Muriel Lester readily sees the bright side of those whom she meets.
('74', 438, 4, 12, 831108) It is not a fault but a virtue.
('74', 438, 4, 13, 831140) There is no one without faults, not even men of God.
('74', 438, 4, 14, 831193) They are men of God not because they are faultless but because they know their own faults, they strive against them, they do not hide them and are ever ready to correct themselves.
('74', 438, 4, 15, 831374) Such is Khan Saheb who prides himself in calling himself a servant of God.
('74', 438, 4, 16, 831449) He is a devout Muslim who never misses his prayers and fasts.
('74', 438, 4, 17, 831511) His interpretation of the Koran is the most liberal I have known.
('74', 438, 4, 18, 831577) He had to make a choice of one from among the workers whose services I had offered him for introducing spinning, etc., among Khudai Khidmat gars.
('74', 438, 4, 19, 831723) He deliberately chose Mirabai, Madeleine Slade.
('74', 438, 4, 20, 831771) She was until recently living under the same roof as Khan Saheb and is now living in rooms adjoining Khan Saheb’s residence where she conducts her class.
('74', 438, 4, 21, 831925) She writes to me almost daily.
('74', 438, 4, 22, 831956) I am glad to be able to say that her letters, though she does not spare those whom she loves, bear out Muriel Lester’s first impression of this noble fakir.
('74', 438, 4, 23, 832113) And yet the English officials have no use for him.
('74', 438, 4, 24, 832164) They fear him and distrust him.
('74', 438, 4, 25, 832196) I would not mind this distrust so much if it did not hamper progress, did not harm India and England and therefore the world.
('74', 438, 4, 26, 832322) BARDOLI, January 23, 1939

('74', 439, 1, 2, 832409) 571. ISLAMIC CULTURE
('74', 439, 2, 3, 832430) A great Muslim asked me what appeared to me strange ques tions the other day.
('74', 439, 2, 4, 832508) Strange, because I should have thought that every Muslim who knows me, and this great Muslim knew me, could answer them for me.
('74', 439, 2, 5, 832636) Here is the dialogue:
('74', 439, 3, 6, 832658) Q. Are you the same to Muslims now that you used to be in South Africa—their friend, father and guide?
('74', 439, 4, 7, 832761) A. I never claimed the privilege of being father to them or anyone in South Africa.
('74', 439, 4, 8, 832845) But I certainly was their guide and friend.
('74', 439, 4, 9, 832889) (I may state in passing that I was addressed as Bhai— brother—by them and others.) I am absolutely the same as I was in South Africa, twenty four years ago.
('74', 439, 4, 10, 833046) I regard Muslims like other Indians as blood brothers entitled to the same rights and privileges as any other Indian.
('74', 439, 5, 11, 833164) Q. Then do you cherish their culture as you would cherish your own Hindu culture?
('74', 439, 6, 12, 833246) A. Of course I do.
('74', 439, 6, 13, 833265) I cannot do otherwise, as I believe Islam and other great religions to be as true as my own.
('74', 439, 6, 14, 833358) India is the richer for the cultures that Islam and Christianity brought with them.
('74', 439, 6, 15, 833442) I regard the present antagonisms as a passing phase.
('74', 439, 7, 16, 833495) Q. Let me be plain.
('74', 439, 7, 17, 833515) I do not believe in Akbar’s dream.
('74', 439, 7, 18, 833550) He aimed at fusing all religions into one and producing a new faith.
('74', 439, 7, 19, 833619) Do you have some such aim?
('74', 439, 8, 20, 833646) A. I do not know what Akbar dreamt.
('74', 439, 8, 21, 833682) I do not aim at any fusion.
('74', 439, 8, 22, 833710) Each religion has its own contribution to make to human evolution.
('74', 439, 8, 23, 833777) I regard the great faiths of the world as so many branches of a tree, each distinct from the other though having the same source.
('74', 439, 9, 24, 833907) Q. I would like you to tell me what you mean by Hindustani.
('74', 439, 9, 25, 833967) Do you favour a common dictionary ?
('74', 439, 10, 26, 834003) A. I have anticipated you.
('74', 439, 10, 27, 834030) I understand that Maulvi Abdul Haq Saheb has produced a dictionary which has taken all the Urdu words that are to be found in the Benares Hindi Lexicon and Hindi words from the Osmania Lexicon.
('74', 439, 10, 28, 834224) I have recommended to the Congress the adoption of the Maulvi Saheb’s dictionary.
('74', 439, 10, 29, 834306) And for new words have suggested a board composed of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad and Rajendra Babu.
('74', 439, 11, 30, 834402) Q. What about the Border Tribes?
('74', 439, 11, 31, 834435) You know they are being crushed under the British heel.
('74', 439, 11, 32, 834491) Will you favour their relations with India being regulated by the Frontier Province?
('74', 440, 0, 1, 834576) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 441
('74', 440, 1, 2, 834625) A. I would most decidedly.
('74', 440, 1, 3, 834652) I have been moving in that direction.
('74', 440, 1, 4, 834690) I have publicly stated more than once that India has to trust and befriend them and not regard them as her natural enemies.
('74', 440, 1, 5, 834814) I have been trying to go in their midst myself and secure the same permission for Badshah Khan.
('74', 440, 1, 6, 834910) There were other questions also asked, but they are not of such public interest as the ones I have dealt with.
('74', 440, 1, 7, 835021) And they are not matters of controversy so far as I know.
('74', 440, 1, 8, 835079) I should like to add here that I have not lost my faith in communal unity.
('74', 440, 1, 9, 835154) My life is still dedicated to it.
('74', 440, 1, 10, 835188) Though a political pact has to come, it will never satisfy me without a heart unity.
('74', 440, 1, 11, 835273) And a heart unity is inconceivable without non violence as the basis of permanent friendship or brotherhood.
('74', 440, 1, 12, 835382) BARDOLI, January 23, 1939

('74', 441, 7, 13, 836373) 575. INTERVIEW TO “THE TIMES OF INDIA”
('74', 441, 8, 14, 836412) BARDOLI, January 24, 1939
('74', 441, 9, 15, 836438) In reply to the correspondent’s question as to what Gandhiji meant by saying in the last week’s Harijan that an all India crisis would occur if the Jaipur authorities persisted in prohibiting the entry of Seth Jamnalal Bajaj into the State, 2 Gandhiji replied: Seth Jamnalal is an all India man, though a subject of Jaipur.
('74', 441, 9, 16, 836762) He is also a member of the Congress Working Committee, and essentially and admittedly a man of peace.
('74', 441, 9, 17, 836864) He is the president of an organization which has been working and has been allowed to work in Jaipur for some years.
('74', 441, 9, 18, 836981) Its activities have always been open.
('74', 441, 9, 19, 837019) It contains well known workers who are sober by disposition and who have done much constructive work, both among men and women.
('74', 441, 9, 20, 837147) There is at the head of affairs in Jaipur a distinguished politico military officer.
('74', 441, 9, 21, 837232) He is shaping the policy of the State in connection with the ban pronounced against Jamnalalji and his association, the Jaipur Rajya Praja Mandal.
('74', 441, 10, 22, 837379) 1 They were published in Harijan, 18 3 1939, 1 4 1939, 15 4 1939, 29 4 1939, 6 5 1939 and 20 5 1939. 2 Vide “Jaipur”
('74', 442, 0, 1, 837496) VOL. 74 : 9 SEPTEMBER, 1938 29 JANUARY, 1939 443
('74', 442, 1, 2, 837545) take it that Sir Beauchamp St. John, Prime Minister of Jaipur, would not be acting without at least the tacit approval of the Central autho rity, without whose consent he could not become the Prime Minister of an important State like Jaipur.
('74', 442, 1, 3, 837787) If the action of the Jaipur authorities precipitates a first class crisis, it is impossible for the Indian National Congress, and therefore all India, to stand by and look on with indifference whilst Jamnalalji, for no offence whatsoever, is imprisoned and members of the Praja Mandal are dealt with likewise.
('74', 442, 1, 4, 838097) The Congress will be neglecting its duty if, having power, it shrank from using it and allowed the spirit of the people of Jaipur to be crushed for want of support from the Congress.
('74', 442, 1, 5, 838280) This is the sense in which I have said that the example of Jaipur, or say Rajkot, might easily lead to an all India crisis.
('74', 442, 1, 6, 838404) The policy of non intervention by the Congress was, in my opinion, a perfect piece of statesmanship when the people of the States were not awakened.
('74', 442, 1, 7, 838553) That policy would be cowardice when there is all round awakening among the people of the States and a determination to go through a long course of suffering for the vindication of their just rights.
('74', 442, 1, 8, 838752) If once this is recognized, the struggle for liberty, wherever it takes place, is the struggle for all India.
('74', 442, 1, 9, 838862) Whenever the Congress thinks it can usefully intervene, it must intervene.
('74', 442, 2, 10, 838937) In answer to a further question how the Congress as an institution and the Congress Ministries in the various provinces were justified in precipitating a crisis on an issue which exclusively concerned a State, Gandhiji said: Supposing in a particular district in British India the Collector butchered the people of that district, is or is not the Congress justified in intervening and precipitating an all India crisis?
('74', 442, 2, 11, 839357) If the answer is ‘yes’, then it applies to Jaipur also for examining the conduct of the Congress in terms of intervention.
('74', 442, 2, 12, 839480) If there had been no non inter vention resolution by the Congress, this question really would not have arisen.
('74', 442, 2, 13, 839591) Therefore, unthinking people very often blame me for having said that constitutionally Indian States were foreign States.
('74', 442, 2, 14, 839713) I do not accept that blame at all.
('74', 442, 2, 15, 839748) I was wandering about in the States and I knew as a matter of fact that the people of the States were not ready.
('74', 442, 2, 16, 839861) The moment they became ready, the legal, constitutional and artificial boundary was destroyed.
('74', 442, 2, 17, 839956) This is a tremendous moral ques tion.
('74', 442, 2, 18, 839994) Constitutionalism, legality and such other things are good enough within their respective spheres, but they become a drag upon human progress immediately the human mind has broken these
('74', 443, 0, 1, 840180) 444 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('74', 443, 1, 2, 840222) artificial bonds and flies higher.
('74', 443, 1, 3, 840257) That is precisely what is happening before my eyes.
('74', 443, 1, 4, 840309) Without any spur from any outside agency I saw at once that there must be intervention by the Congress of the type you see today.
('74', 443, 1, 5, 840439) And it will go on from stage to stage, if the Congress remains the moral force that it has become—in other words, if the Congress lives up to its policy of non violence.
('74', 443, 1, 6, 840609) People say that I have changed my view, that I say today some thing different from what I said years ago.
('74', 443, 1, 7, 840715) The fact of the matter is that conditions have changed.
('74', 443, 1, 8, 840771) I am the same.
('74', 443, 1, 9, 840786) My words and deeds are dictated by prevailing conditions.
('74', 443, 1, 10, 840844) There has been a gradual evolu tion in my environment and I react to it as a satyagrahi.
('74', 443, 2, 11, 840933) The correspondent next drew Gandhiji’s attention to recent developments in Rajkot and in Baroda, where the minorities were protesting against the Congress dictation.
('74', 443, 2, 12, 841099) Gandhiji said in reply that he was unperturbed by those developments.
('74', 443, 2, 13, 841169) He said: The movement for liberty cannot possibly be withdrawn or arrested because there are at the moment so called communal splits.
('74', 443, 2, 14, 841303) I see that history is repeating itself and the power that is losing ground is becoming desperate and fomenting trouble and dissension within, hoping to drag on its existence by means of these dissensions.
('74', 443, 2, 15, 841508) If the people know how to work the non violent technique, the powers that are acting in this manner will be confounded and the people will rise victorious.
('74', 443, 2, 16, 841664) The Muslims in Rajkot, for instance, have everything to gain by the people of Rajkot securing liberty.
('74', 443, 2, 17, 841767) They are today depending upon the sweet will, not of the Rulers, but of the advisers of the Rulers; tomorrow they will share power with the people because they are of the people.
('74', 443, 2, 18, 841946) But I really do not believe that there is real Muslim opposition in Rajkot.
('74', 443, 2, 19, 842022) They have enjoyed the best relations with the Hindus.
('74', 443, 2, 20, 842076) I know this from personal experience myself.
('74', 443, 2, 21, 842121) During the three months’ brief but brilliant struggle there was no dissension bet ween the Hindus and the Muslims in Rajkot.
('74', 443, 2, 22, 842246) Though many Mus lims did not court imprisonment, the Muslims as a community remained at the back of the agitation.
('74', 443, 2, 23, 842361) I really do not understand this unfortunate squabble in Baroda.
('74', 443, 2, 24, 842425) I am as yet too paralysed to get a full grasp of the situation.
('74', 443, 2, 25, 842489) There again, what can Maharashtrians lose if there is self rule in Baroda?
